Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	Thus begin the words of Albucasis.
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	O, children, since I have completed this book for you, which is the last of the science of medicine, by its completion its end is achieved, and through its explanations and declarations, it seems to me that I have fulfilled it for you with this treatise, which is a part of the practical application of the art, that is, surgery.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	For the art of surgery is now, in our region and time, almost entirely lost, so that the science of it is greatly endangered, and its knowledge is obscured; and of it only some brief descriptions remain in the books of the ancients, which, through the passage of time, have given rise to errors and uncertainties, until its understanding is clouded and its strength and art have diminished.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	And it seems to me that I can revitalize it [the art of surgery] by means of this treatise, in accordance with the method of exposition, declaration, and summary; and that it may be understood through the descriptions of cautery instruments and other surgical tools, accompanied by an explanation and preparation of them, a necessary process.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	However, the reason why a skilled craftsman with a skilled hand is not found in our time is that the art of medicine is extensive, and its practitioner needs to be versed in the science of anatomy, which describes the parts of the body so that he knows the structure and form of the limbs, their connection and separation; and has knowledge of the bones, nerves and muscles, their numbers, and their distribution; and of the pulsating and stationary veins, and the places from which they arise.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	And therefore Hippocrates says that a name is much, but the work is little, especially in the art of handcraft.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	But we have already discussed this in the introduction to this book; for whoever is ignorant of what we have said about anatomy will inevitably fall into errors that will cause people to die, as I have seen many such instances, for some are trained in this science, but abandon it without knowledge and experience.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	For I saw an unskilled and foolish physician open a scrofulous abscess on a woman's neck, and cut some arteries in the neck, causing a large amount of blood to flow until the woman died in his hands.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	And I saw another physician attempt to remove a stone from a man who had grown old, and the stone was large; he went to him and removed the stone along with a piece of the bladder, so that the man died on the third day.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	And I already warned against doing that, and saw that due to the size of the stone and the patient's condition, I knew beforehand that he would die.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	And I saw another physician, who received payment from a duke in our land for surgery, and went to a dark-skinned man whose leg was fractured; the physician, due to his ignorance, reduced the fracture, pressing against the wound with bandages and splints with excessive force, and did not allow the wound to breathe.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	And then he treated it according to his own desires, and bound it together, and left it for several days, and commanded that we loosen the ligature; and it remained like that until the thigh and foot became infected with an abscess, and led to ruin.
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	And I was called to him, and I proceeded to loosen the ligature, and achieved tranquility and alleviation of his pain.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	However, corruption had already taken hold in the limb, so I could not stop it, and the corruption continued in the limb until the patient perished.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	And I saw another physician who opened a cancerous abscess, and it became ulcerated in a few days, until the evil of it was greatly aggravated by the patient's condition.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	Because cancerous tumors are pure melancholy humor, therefore they should not be treated with a complete cauterization, unless the limb is deemed to be completely diseased.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	Therefore, children, it is necessary for you that the surgical operation be divided into two parts: one being the operation associated with health, and the other, an operation that is perilous in the most extreme cases.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	And I have already described this throughout this book, where there is operation that involves error and fear; therefore, it is necessary for you to guard against this and abandon it, so that the fools may not find a way to speak ill and disgrace you.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	Therefore, take your tools with diligence and with God's protection, and treat your patients with skill and firmness.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	And use the best method, through God's grace, seeking health and a praiseworthy outcome, and abandon terrible illnesses with difficult cures, and remove from your practice anything that causes you fear, so that your dedication to your faith and your name may not fail you: for greater glory remains for you, and higher in the world and behind your holiness.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	Gualia has already said in some of his teachings:
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	Do not treat a serious illness, lest you be called bad doctors.
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	And I have divided this book into three chapters.
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	Begins the division of the book, and first of the first part.
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	The first chapter, ordered from head to foot, describes the forms of instruments and the implements of cauteries, and what is necessary for the operation.
La divisio de la segonda partida.	The division of the second part.
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	The second chapter, of incision and perforation, and of cupping, and of plasters, and of the extraction of arrows and similar things, is entirely categorised and ordered according to the forms of the instruments.
Divisio de la tersa partida.	Division of the third part.
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	The third chapter, on restoration and dislocation, and on the treatment of twisting and similar things; a chapter ordered from head to foot, and concerning the forms of the instruments.
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	Of cauterization with fire and with sharp medicine, and a reminder of the operation.
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	With that begins the treatise of the entire book.
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	It is necessary for me to describe the benefits of this cautery and its harms, and in what constitution cautery is prohibited.
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	Therefore, I say that the discourse on the nature of the benefits of cautery and its harms is a long and verbose discourse, subtle in its science, and a hidden secret; and many wise men have already spoken of it, and they have disagreed about it, and it suffices for me to briefly mention some of their discourses, fearing length.
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	And therefore I say that cautery benefits all constitutions universally, whether with or without matter, except for two constitutions, which are hot constitutions without matter.
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	In the hot and dry constitution with matter, there is disagreement; for some say that cautery is beneficial in that case, and others say the opposite, that cautery is not suitable in an illness characterized by heat and dryness, because the nature of fire is heat and dryness, and it is undesirable to treat a hot and dry illness with something that is also hot and dry.
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	And those who say the opposite claim that cautery provides benefit in every hot and dry illness that afflicts humans, for when you compare the body and its humours to the constitution of fire, you find the human body to be cold.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	And I say, concerning this matter, that experience has shown this to me several times.
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	However, this should not be accepted without careful consideration by someone who is already experienced and skilled in the practice of cautery, who has understood the diversity of human constitutions, the various types of illnesses, their causes, the symptoms, and the appropriate timeframes for treatment.
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	But in other constitutions, you have no need for such caution, and especially in cold and moist illnesses, for all physicians have agreed on this, and are not in disagreement about the use of cautery in those cases.
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	And understand, children, that the secret of healing through cautery with fire, and its goodness, lies in the difference between cautery with fire and cautery with medicinal remedies.  This is because fire is simple; its action affects only the member being cauterized, and does not harm other members connected to it except with minor damage.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	However, the action of medicinal cauterization extends to the affected member and the surrounding areas, and it can easily introduce difficult-to-cure illnesses and pain to the member itself.
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	But fire, due to its purity and beneficial nature, does not do this; it simply removes excess.  We already know this from experience and a long study of the art and the truth of its causes; therefore I excuse myself from further lengthy discourse.  And if it were not that this topic, concerning the secret of fire's application to the body, and its ability to expel illnesses through its specific action, is already covered in detail in my book,  I would demonstrate its operation with a philosophical and conclusive argument, to enlighten you better.
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	And understand, children, that they disagree on the best time for cautery, and consider springtime the most suitable.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	And I say that cautery is appropriate at all times, because the harm caused by unfavorable timing is overshadowed by the benefit of what is drawn out by the cautery, especially if the cautery is necessary for sharp, sudden pains, which cannot tolerate delay, as the fear of greater harm from a prolonged illness outweighs any small harm from an immediate cautery.
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	And this is not something to consider, my children, it is only the opinion of the common people and foolish physicians, that is, that a disease cured by cautery does not always require a return to the original state, and that condition is considered to be sufficient.
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	And the reason is not as they think, for cautery is not a replacement for medicine, but rather an alteration of the body's constitution, drying out the moisture that causes the pain.
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	However, cautery is superior to medicine in terms of its power and efficacy and the greatness of its effect.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	And it is possible for the illness to return at some point in time, depending on the patient's constitution, the location of the illness, and the patient's resilience, and the build-up of excess fluids within them, and what has been consumed in food and similar matters; but if the illness for which cautery is administered is a localized illness with limited excess fluids and moisture, like toothache and similar conditions, it is possible that the pain will not return there, but this happens in a milder form.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	And it is a common saying that cautery is the last resort in medicine, and it is a truthful statement, not in the way they understand it, for they believe there is no cure that works as well as cautery.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	And the truth is the opposite; the idea that cautery is the last resort in medicine is only true when we've tried other treatments for some illnesses, and those treatments did not work, and only then, at the end of the line, is cautery administered, and proves useful.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	Therefore, from this, it can be seen that cautery is the last resort in medicine, not according to the understanding of the common people and many foolish doctors.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	And the ancients said that cautery with gold is better than cautery with iron, and they did not say this except because of the nobility and superior quality of gold's substance.
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	And they said that the place of cautery doesn't burn, which is absolutely not true, for I have already tested this and found that it only happens in some bodies and not others, and cautery with gold is good and better than with iron, as they said; however, when you do cautery with gold fire, it isn't clear to you, because it ignites according to the amount you want due to the gold's resilience, and because it prepares to receive cold; and if you apply heat to it, the gold melts by the fire, and some of the gold falls into the fire, so that the craftsman is burned by working with it.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	Therefore, cautery with iron is done more easily and more readily for the correct performance of the operation.
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	And I have organized this chapter on cautery according to sections, and I have ordered them from the head down to the feet, so that the seeker may find what he wants in it.
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	Of cautery for head pain caused by cold and moisture.
Le capitol primier.	The first chapter.
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cauterization remedies moisture and coldness affecting the brain, the cause of which are twofold:  a cause of stiffness and a multitude of rheumatic flows, called "corissa" [likely a form of rhinitis], flowing from the head to the eyes and ears, a multitude of sleep disorders, toothaches, and throat ailments, and universally any illness brought on by coldness, such as paralysis, stroke, and similar ailments.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The method of this cauterization is this: first, you should order the patient to be purged with laxatives, cleansing the head, for three or four nights, according to the patient's strength, age, and usual constitution.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	And then you instruct him to shave his head, and then make him sit between your hands on a smooth bench and have him place his hands on his feet.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	And then place the tip of your palm, near the bridge, on the root of his nose between his eyes.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	However, when the tip of your middle finger has reached that spot, mark that spot with a probe, and then apply the olive cautery, of which this is the form:
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	And then place that [cautery] on the spot marked with the probe, so that it descends, with which your hand is gradually tightened, and you turn it.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	And then gently raise your hand and look at the area, and if you see any significant amount of bone exposed, roughly the size of a grain of millet, then raise your hand, and if not, return your hand with that iron, with another one of those, if it is chilled, until the bone is visible as I have told you.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	And then take a little salt and dissolve it on the area and leave it for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	Then place a piece of cloth soaked in butter on it and leave it there until the scab from the burning is destroyed.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	And then treat the area with tetrafarmacon ointment until it is healed.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	And if the wound remains open, it is better to move the arm, because this is better and more beneficial.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	And some of them say that the bone should be cauterized down to the bone, and the cautery should be held until a part of the bone's surface is burnt.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	And then scrape away what has adhered to the bone, and then treat it.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	And others say that with the cautery, they should reach the back, to strongly press on the bone until it breaks, and this is the method of a small (minor) cauterization.
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	And they believe that vapors from the head escape from that location.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	And the wound should be kept open for a long time, and then treated until it is healed.
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	However, I have not seen these two types of cauterization in every case, but only in some men according to the way of fear; and in my view, it is better, when possible, with the treatment, because the head is weakened by a disruption of continuity in it, just as we have attested in other limbs, and even more so when the patient's head is of weak constitution.
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	And the first type of cauterization is safer and better in my opinion; and using that method and procedure will be beneficial.
Capitol segon.	Second Chapter.
Del cauteri del cap.	Of the cauterization of the head.
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	When there is chronic and long-lasting pain in the whole head of a prolonged illness, and the patient has used leeches, cupping, head purges, plasters, poultices, herbs, and similar treatments, and especially if they have already been cauterized with a cautery we have discussed and it hasn't been of any help, then consider that if the patient's head is of strong constitution, and it is not weak and has a great deal of cold, then cauterize with another cautery beneath the first one, a little below.
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	And then cauterize that area on the top of their head with the cautery until the scab is broken.
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.	Cut the scab open and expose the bone to the extent we have described, and cauterize that area with a cautery on the back of the head in the place called the *vas*—and that is the spot where a cupping glass is placed.
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	And ease your hand in doing this, and do not expose the bone, for the patient will experience very great pain different from the pain of all other cauteries of the head.
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	And I would say this cautery is in its proper place, for the cautery used to cauterize the temples and the back of the head should be a more delicate cautery than the one used for the middle of the head; and this is the manner of it.
Capitol ters.	Third Chapter.
De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	Of the cauterization of not-ancient (or, perhaps, non-chronic) migraine.
Quan endeve en la partida del cap dolor sodo, o es stenduda dolor entro al uelh, sia evacuat am medicinas le cap mondificantz, e sia aministrada l’autra curacio, la qual yeu he dita en las devesios de las malautias; e tot no aprofieyta, lahoras cauterisacio en lu es en dos manieyras: o cauterisacio am medicina acuta comburent, o am ferr.	When pain is sudden or spreading within the head, the head should be treated with purifying medications, and the other cure, which I have described in the discussions of illnesses, should also be administered.  If this proves ineffective, then cauterization in that location can be done in two ways: either with a burning medicinal cautery, or with an iron cautery.
Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	But a cautery with a burning medicine is that you take a clove of garlic, and drain it and cauterize the ends of both of its heads.
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.	And then, you should make an incision at the location of the pain in the temple with a sharp lancet until a small area beneath the skin has been created and is hidden.
E aprop strenh sobre lu am stopada per descent constreccio, e layssa aquel per le spazi de tres horas; e aprop deslia le e tratz le alh, e laysa la plagua per dos o per tres jorn, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto submergit en boder entro que le loc fassa brac.	Then apply a bandage to compress it, and leave it for three hours.  Then remove it and the garlic, and allow the wound to heal for two or three days, and then apply a compress of wool soaked in broth until the area is healed.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then treat it with ointment until it is healed.
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	And if you wish, do this with some burning medicines, which I have written about in the second treatise on burning medicines.
Mays la cauterisacio am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: igneys per cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	But the cauterization with iron, according to this method: fire by cautery, of which this is the form:
e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	and it is called a "claus clavilhs," because its head is shaped like a nail, in which there is a slight curvature, and in its middle is a small elevation.
E aprop pausa sobre loc de la dolor, e rete la tua ma — per que no sia adhurida la arceria la qual es dejos — e revol le ferr petit a petit am velocitat.	And then place it on the painful area, and hold your hand — so that the surrounding tissue is not burned — and turn the small iron slowly but with speed.
E si la quantitat de lu que es adhurida per la specitut de la codena ayssi quo la maytat de lu, e elava la tua ma per so que la arteria no sia adhurida la qual es dejos, per so que no vengua flux de sanc.	And if the amount of tissue that is burned by the cautery's heat is about half of it, then lift your hand so that the artery underneath is not burned, lest blood flow results.
E aprop enbibeys coto en aygua de sal e pausa aquel sobre le loc, e layssa aquel per tres dias; e aprop pausa coto mulhat am boder, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Then soak some cotton in salt water and place it over the area, and leave it for three days; then place cotton moistened with butter, and then treat with ointment until healed.
E si voys, cauterisa am la extremitat del cutellari segon cauteri, e guarda te de incisio de arteria en aquesta emigranea propriament no-antiqua.	And if you wish, cauterize with the edge of a scalpel, like a cautery, and be careful not to cut an artery in this particular, not-ancient, method.
Capitol quart.	Fourth Chapter.
De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	On the cauterization of ancient migraine.
Quan tu curas emigranea am aquo que havem dit de la curacio precedent, e aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias, e no aprofieyta la curacio, e vezes per la malautia que no abasta a lu aquo que havem dit del primier cauteri am medicina o del cauteri am foc, lahoras cove que tu igniscas le cauteri cutellar entro que sia albificat, pus que significas sobre le loc de la dolor am linha de longuesa de la qual sia la maytat del dit, o quays aquel; e depausa la tua ma per una veguada e strenh aquela entro incidiscas la arceria e pervengua entro al os.	When you treat migraine with what we have said about the previous treatment, and what we have said in the divisions of diseases, and the treatment does not work, and sometimes because the disease does not respond to what we have said about the first cauterization with medicine or cauterization with fire, then you must heat the knife-cautery until it is white-hot, and then apply it to the painful area along a line that is half the length of your finger, or even less; and press your hand once, and hold it until you cut through the flesh and reach the bone.
Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s’endevengua espasme.	However, it is necessary for you to be mindful of the continuity of the jawbone, which is strained by chewing, and that the ligament and the nerve that control it are not injured and do not cause spasm.
E si es sobre la custodia e cautela de flux de sanc de l’arteria que es abciza, quar en la abcizio de lu es temor, e majorment ad aquel le qual ignora aquo que fa e no es studios e esproat; e layssa la operacio en lu al comensament.	And if it is about the care and caution of the flow of blood from the severed artery, for fear arises in its severance, especially for one who does not know what they are doing and is not skilled or experienced; and lets the operation be unfinished at the beginning.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio del regiment de flux de sanc accident de la arceria segon la sieua manieyra, en le sieu loc de aquest libre.	And I will come back to the treatment of accidental blood flow from the artery according to its method, in its place within this book.
E si veses de aquesta malautia que no abaste aquest cauteri e veses le cors del malaute tollerable, cauteriza aquel en le mieg loc del cap ayssi cum havem recontat, e cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	And if you see that this treatment does not cure this ailment and the patient's condition seems bearable, cauterize the middle of the head as we have described, and treat the wound until it heals.
E si voys, aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le capitol de streccio de arceria am cauteri havent dos cotels, e es milhor cauterizacio aquesta e mays conferent.	And if you wish, administer the cautery we described in the chapter on artery constriction with a cautery having two blades, and this is a better and more useful cauterization.
Capitol .v.	Chapter 5.
De cauterisacio de las dolors de aurelhas.	Of the cauterization of earaches.
Quan en la aurelha ve dolor per freg e es curat am causas lacsativas e am l’autra curacio la qual he dita en la divisio, e no es remauguda la dolor, lahoras igneys le cauteri, e es aquest le qual ha nom puncta, del qual aquesta es la forma:	When pain in the ear comes from cold and is treated with laxatives and the other treatment I mentioned in the division, and the pain does not go away, then cauterize the ear with a cautery, and this is the one called a "puncta," and this is its form:
E aprop puncta aprop la ignicio, e sia menat al enviro de tota la aurelha ayssi cum roda es revolguda, o en le circuit de quascuna essemps si la dolor es en quascuna.	And then puncture near the ignition, and let it move around the entire ear in a circular fashion, or in the circuit of each affected spot if the pain is in multiple places.
Alonga te am le cauteri de la razit de la aurelha pauc a pauc pus que aias senhat le loc am tenta.	Move the cautery along the ear's base slowly, after marking the location with a probe.
E si le cauteri de detz puntz en tota aurelha, e quays aquela, e aprop cura les locz entro que sian sanatz.	And if the cautery makes ten points on the entire ear, cauterize those areas, and then treat the spots until they are healed.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter 6.
De cauterizacio de turtura.	Concerning the cauterization of tumors.
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	Tumors which are cured by cauterization are only of the types that arise from phlegm, as we have stated in the divisions of diseases.
Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.	Avoid cauterization of the type that comes from drying out or spasms of the nerve.
Quan tu curas aquela specia de turtura am jerras e capipurgi e guarguarismes, e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas le malaute am tres cauteris: la i deves la razit de la aurelha, e·l segon un petit dejos le sieu templar, e le ters deves la conjunccio de doas labias.	When you treat that type of tumor with leeches, purges, and remedies, and your treatment does not prove effective, then you should cauterize the patient with three cauteries: the first at the root of the ear, the second a small one below their temple, and the third at the juncture of the two lips.
E pausa lo tieu cauteri per le contrari de la partida malauta, quar mollificacio no ve sino en la partida que apar sana.	And place your cautery on the opposite side of the diseased area, for softening occurs only on the side that appears healthy.
E la forma de cauterisacio es que cauterizas aquel am le cauteri en le dreyt de la extremitat de la aurelha pus sobirana un petit sobre le corn del cap, e en le templar autre, la longuesa del qual sia segon la longitut del dit pous, e depausa la tua ma am cauteri entro que sia comburida la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena.	And the method of cauterization is to cauterize with the cautery on the right side of the ear's extremity, then slightly higher on the temple, and another on the temple, the length of which should be according to the length of the fingertip, and hold your cautery until the amount of the affected area is about half consumed/burnt.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.	And this is the method of cauterization, and it is a type of surgery, the method of which is described above.
Mays empero pus subtil es que aquel un pauc ayssi co vesas; e cove que cotel en lu de superflua groceza un pauc.	However, it is more subtle than what you've seen; and one needs to cut away any superfluous fat/thickness slightly.
E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	And then treat the area with what was previously described until it is healed.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter 7.
De cauterizacio de apoplextia antiqua.	Concerning the cauterization of old apoplexy.
Quan apoplextia es antiquada e curas aquela am aquo que havem dit e no confereys la tua medicacio e le malaute no ha febre, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris: sobre totz les corn del sieu cap; e am cauteri e le mieg loc del cap, ayssi cum havem dit; e am cauteri en le coguot.	When apoplexy is longstanding, and you've treated it with what we've discussed, and the patient shows no fever, then cauterize the area with four cauteries: one on each temple (corner of the head); one in the middle of the head, as described previously; and one on the nape of the neck (occiput).
E la manieyra del cauteri es fayta segon que es desus dit.	And the method of cauterization is done as previously stated.
E ja es cauterizat sobre la boca del estomac; e es mays derier; e aprop sia curat am aquo que procezeys.	And it has already been cauterized on the opening of the stomach; and further back; and subsequently be treated with what follows.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter 8.
De cauterizacio de obblivio fayta per flacma.	On cauterization for forgetfulness caused by a flame.
Cove que sian donatz al malaute en le comensament jerras grans e pilulas le servel mondificantz.	Large jars and pills should be given to the patient at the beginning, to purify the brain.
E aprop ras le cap tot del malaute e pausa sus le coguot de lu emplaustre de cetre descrit en le tractat dels emplastres.	And then shave the patient's entire head and apply a plaster of cedar described in the treatise on plasters.
E pausa aquel alcunas veguadas, quar aquel es manieyra de cauteri.	And apply it several times, for this is a method of cauterization.
E fay aquo segon aquel meteys orde le qual ja he dit.	And do this according to the same order I have already mentioned.
E donc si per aqueles sanat bo es; e sino, lahoras fay a lu tres cauteris en la deriera partida de sieu cap, les quals sian deysendentz de la partida pus sobirana del cap entro a la partida pus dejos del col.	And so, if this treatment is successful, well and good; but if not, then make three cauteries on the back of their head, descending from the highest part of the head to the lowest part of the neck.
E pausa entre quascun cauteri la grossetut del dit, e aprop cura lo cauteri am aquo que es procedit.	And place the thickness of a finger between each cautery, and then treat the cautery with what has been previously described.
Mays si tu vos addicio e le malaute es aquo tollerant, lahoras fay a lu cauteri en le mieg loc; e si voys major addicio, lahora cauteriza aquel sobre les dos corns.	But if you wish to add more, and the patient tolerates it, then make a cautery in the middle area; and if you want a greater addition, then cauterize the area above the two horns.
Aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat; e sia le cauteri olivar segon la forma denant donat.	Then treat it until it is healed; and let the cautery be olive-shaped, according to the form previously given.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter 9.
De cauterisacio de parazili e de mollificacio de tot le cors.	Concerning the cauterization of paralysis and the softening of the entire body.
Cove que tu procesiscas en mondificacio del cap am jerras e am aquo que havem dit; e aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap, e am cauteri sobre totz les corns del cap, e am cauteri sobre la deriera partida de lu, e am tres cauteris sobre les spondils del col.	You should proceed with the cleansing of the head with herbs and what we have mentioned; then shave the patient's head, and then cauterize it with a cautery in the middle of the head, and with cauteries on all the horns of the head, and with a cautery on the back part of it, and with three cauteries on the vertebrae of the neck.
E si es necessari en la malautia de mollificacio del cors de trops aquel e les malautes tollerantz e la malautia es fort, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e dererament am cauteri entro que sia comborit de la codena mot de lu, e aleva la tieua ma.	And if in the illness of the softening of the body, the patient is tolerant and the illness is severe, then cauterize it with four cauteries on the vertebrae of the back, and continually with a cautery until it is softened from the backbone, and remove your hand.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat, e aquest sia cauteri olivar.	And then treat it until it is healed, and this should be an olive oil cautery.
Capitol .x.	Chapter 10.
De cauterisacio de epilemcia.	Concerning the cauterization of epilepsy.
No es cauterizat le epilemtic sino aquella epilemcia es per flecma.	The epileptic is not cauterized unless the epilepsy is due to phlegm.
E donc cove que mondifiques le cervel de lu al comensament de lu am yeras e am l’autra curacio la qual havem dicta en la divisio quan le malaute es gran e es tollerant la exceperacio de las medicinas.	Therefore, it is necessary to treat the brain at the outset with herbs and other treatments that we have described in the division, when the illness is severe and can tolerate the depletion of medicines.
E si es enfant le qual no sufferte las medicinas, lahoras aministra guarguarissmes e mastiguatoris le servel mondifican, denant aquo per motz dias, am bonifficacio de las viandas.	And if it is a child who cannot tolerate the medicines, then administer remedies and masticatories that treat the brain, for several days beforehand, along with a good diet.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en le mieg loc del cap segon la manieyra precedent, e am autre cauteri en le occiput de lu, e sobre quascun corn del cap sieu cauterisa.	And then shave the patient's head, and then cauterize it with a cautery in the middle of the head, according to the previous method, and with another cautery on the back of their head, and cauterize on each side of the head.
E si le malaute es fort e es tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteris les quals he ditz, en havent paraliticament e mollificacio del cors sobre les spondils del col e les spondils del dos.	And if the illness is severe and can tolerate it, then cauterize it with the cauteries mentioned, having simultaneously applied paralysis and softening of the body to the vertebrae of the neck and the vertebrae of the back.
E sia cauteri olivar segon qu’es precedit.	Let the cautery be olive-shaped, as previously described.
Mays si le malaute es enfant, lahoras pausa cauteri subtil segon aquesta manieyra.	But if the patient is a child, then apply a smaller cautery according to this method.
Capitol .xi.	Chapter 11.
De cauterizacio de melencolia.	On the cauterization of melancholy.
Quan las causas de melencolia so humiditatz corrompudas e flacma gros, lahoras cauteriza aquel am les cauteris les quals havem ditz en le havent paralisi.	When the causes of melancholy are corrupted moisture and thick phlegm, then cauterize that with the cauteries we have mentioned in the previous discussion on paralysis.
E si la causa de melencolia es superfluitat declinant a melencolia, e le cors del malaute es humit, lahoras da ha beure aquo que mundifica le cervel de lu segon aquo que ha precedut en la divisio.	And if the cause of melancholy is an excess leaning towards melancholy, and the patient's body is moist, then give him to drink that which cleanses his brain according to what has been previously described in the division.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop fay tortora decentment fayta de li sobre le cercle, e aprop depausa aquela en le mieg loc del cap.	And then shave the patient's head, and then apply a properly made torquetum (a type of bandage or device) around the head, and then place it in the middle of the head.
E le malaute sia sesent cayrat, e sia tengut de tota partida.	And the patient should be seated upright, and held securely in all parts of the body.
E aprop pausa liniment; et es pus digne de boder antic de ovelhas.	And then apply a liniment; and it is better to use old sheep's wool.
E escalfa aquel sobre le foc per calefaccio temprada per mesura, le qual le dit sufferta quan es mes en lu.	And warm that over the fire with a measured, moderate heat, which the said patient can tolerate when placed on him.
E aprop vuo’ aquel en le mieg loc del cap de lu en le cercle, e leysa lu entro que sia enfregidat.	And then place that in the middle of his/her head, within the bandage/torquetum, and leave it until it is cooled.
E fay aquo am le malaute en tota semmana una veguada, am le autre regiment de lu bo entro que sia sanat; o si vols, cauteriza aquel fazen petitz puntz segon lo mays de lu, sino que tenguas la ma am un cauteri ayssi ordenat: aquesta es specia de cauteri la qual humecta le cervel am equalitat.	And do this with the patient once a week, along with the rest of their treatment until they are healed; or, if you wish, cauterize that area making small punctures according to his/her tolerance, holding the hand with a cautery specially designed for this; this is a type of cautery that moistens the brain evenly.
E aprop pausa aquel coto enbegut en boder o en grays de gualina.	And then place that cloth soaked in wool or henbane.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter 12.
De cauterisacio de aygua descendent en le huel.	On the cauterization of descending water in the ear.
Quan a tu es declarat le comensament de aygua en le huel per les senhals les quals yeu he ditz en la divisio, lahoras comensa e dona en beure al malaute aquo que mondifique le cap de lu, e guarda aquel de totas humiditatz.	When you have observed the initial symptoms of water in the ear, as described in the previous section, then begin by giving the patient drinks that will help clear their head, and keep them from excess moisture.
E fay aquel suzar en banh en degu per alcus jorns.	And make them sweat in a bath for a few days.
E aprop comanda a lu que raza le sieu cap, e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap; e aprop cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre dos templas si es le comensament de ysement de aygua en dos huels, o de la un latz si es comensamen de l’aygua en un huel.	And then command that the patient shave their head, and cauterize the affected area in the middle of the head; and then cauterize with two cauteries on both temples if the onset of water is in both ears, or on one temple if the water is in only one ear.
Incideys am cauteri totas las venas e arcerias las quals so dejos la codena; e sian les cauteris en aquela lonh en la latitut de las templas.	Cauterize all the veins and arteries beneath the scalp; and let the cauteries be located as far apart as the temples.
E guarda te de fluxs de sanc quan es cauterizat; e si veses de lu fluxs de sanc, osta le am alcuna medicina, la qual es a tu possible.	And beware of blood flow during the cauterization; and if you see blood flow, stop it with any medicine possible.
E yeu vindre am savieza la qual es en extraccio de arcerias e am abscizio de aquelas e cautela de fluxs de sanc.	And I will come with the knowledge that is in the extraction of arteries and the excision of them and the prevention of blood flow.
E alcunas vetz es cauterizat en le cervitz dejos dos osses am dos cauteris dererament produzitz.	And sometimes the neck is cauterized below the two bones with two cauteries placed directly in contact.
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter 13.
De cauterizacio de lacrimas antiquas.	Of cauterization of old sores.
Quan lacrimas dels huels so antiquas assuduament e per las venas e arterias las quals so en le loc manifest del cap defora e es verificat que aquo es superfluitatz frejas flecmatiquas, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri le qual havem recontat en le capitol de comensament de aygua cazent en les huels, e am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos templas, e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos osses.	When sores on the face are chronic and through the veins and arteries that are in the visible area of the head, and it is verified that this is a superfluity of cold phlegm, then cauterize it with the cautery we have described in the chapter on applying hot water to sores, and with a cautery in the middle of the head, and with two cauteries on the neck below the temples, and with two cauteries on the neck below the two bones.
E si indigeyses de addicio, lahoras cauteriza aquel en tot latz de la coa del huel sobre la extremitat del sobrecilh am petit cauteri.	And if you need further treatment, then cauterize it along the entire length of the sore's edge, on the end of the eyebrow, with a small cautery.
Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter 14.
De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	Concerning the cauterization of nasal foul odor.
Quan tu medicas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no aprofieyta la tua medicacio, lahoras tu aparelha e dona en beure al malaute las cochias per tres noytz; e aprop ras le cap de lu, e cauteriza le am cauteri migier am cauteri olivar.	If your treatment using the methods described in the division is unsuccessful, then prepare and give the patient porridge to drink for three nights; afterwards, shave the patient's head, and cauterize it with a middle-sized cautery and an olive-oil cautery.
E aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri clavelh am dos cauteris sobre les dos sobrecilhs dejos les cabels un petit.	And then cauterize it with a clove-shaped cautery, using two cauteries on both eyebrows below the hair, a small one for each.
E guarda te de la arceria que no incindas aquela.	And be careful of the sparks, lest you set it alight.
E del cauteri clavilh aquesta es la forma.	And this is the shape of the clove-shaped cautery.
Capitol .xv.	Chapter 15.
De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	Of cauterization for softening the eyelids of the eyes.
Quan la palpebra del huel es mollificada per malautia o per humiditat, lahoras cauteriza aquela palpebre1 am un cauteri am aquest cauteri lunar; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When the eyelid of the eye is softened by illness or moisture, then cauterize that eyelid with a cautery using this lunar cautery; and this is its form:
E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.	And if you cauterize a small area above the two eyebrows with two cauteries on all sides, and they should be extended away from the temples.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la quantitat del sobrecil.	And the length of each cautery should be according to the size of the eyebrow.
E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	And do not press too hard with your hand and the cautery, but according to the quantity needed for one-third of the eyelid to be adhered.
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter 16.
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	Concerning cauterization of the eyelid when the hairs are turned inwards and the eye is inflamed.
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	When the hairs of the eye are turned inwards, causing inflammation, cauterization in those cases is done in two ways: either with a burning iron or with a cauterizing medicine.
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	If with a cauterizing iron, tell the patient beforehand to remove their eyelashes, just as they would clean them, until they are elongated and spread out; and if those hairs are inflamed near their roots, then you should bind the eyes with a bandage so that they are not injured until the hairs have regrown.
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	Then, once they have grown back and spread out, place the patient's head on your lap, and carefully apply a cauterizing agent to the eyelid with a small tool, shaped like a leaf, starting near the hairs.
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	Then place cotton soaked in egg white or a pthilli (likely a type of medicinal preparation) over the eye.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	And then heat the cautery iron, which has this specific shape.
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	And then cauterize in small, repeated passes, following the shape you marked, until the surface of the inflamed area, which resembles a myrtle leaf, has been completely burned.
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	A sign of successful treatment is that you see the eyelid contracted and the hairs raised towards the puncture wound on the eye.
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	And then elevate your hand and leave it like that for three days, and then place cotton with a bandage over it until the scab is gone.
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then treat it with ointment until it is healed.
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.	But if any cause returns to the place of origin and the eyelid is softened, then do the cauterization again, exactly as you did at first.
Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.	But if the hairs are under the eyelid, then cauterize it until it is raised to its natural position and is smoothed, and the hairs do not irritate the eye.
Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	But the cautery with a burning medicine, which you order the patient to leave the hairs until they are stretched and smoothed, and then a form of myrtle leaf is made of cloth.
E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. i, o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.	And then take a known herb and a living animal's fat, or something like that, and mix those things well, and do this quickly so it doesn't get cold.  Then spread this mixture over the cloth shaped like a myrtle leaf, and place it over the one or both eyes.  Place a cloth soaked in egg white under the eye, and the patient's head should be on a pillow.
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc.	And place the fingertip on the medicine and press it a little bit, and do not remove it until the patient feels the medicine's burning sensation, for the burning sensation should be like that of fire.
E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	And then, as long as the patient feels the burning sensation, leave the medicine in place and hold it with your finger.  Once the burning sensation stops, remove the medicine and wash the eye with water.  Then, consider whether the eyelid has been lifted to the correct position by the cauterization, either burning or incision.  If so, it is correct.  If not, apply more medicine to the area where it wasn't previously applied and repeat until the eyelid is smoothed out and the eye is healed.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.	Then apply a bandage to the area until the burning sensation is gone, and then treat it with a specific ointment or another remedy until it is healed.
E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.	You must, after your procedure, carefully watch that no medicine gets into the eye.  If, after a few days, the eyelid is swollen and some of the medicine is in the eye, then re-apply your medicine to that swollen part of the eyelid, as you did in the beginning.  And continue to do so until it is healed.
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	And this is the method of treating a wound with myrtle leaves.
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	Understand that human wounds vary in size and severity, and therefore your treatment is adjusted accordingly.
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	And the path to recovery for the one studying this art will not be hidden.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter 17.
De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	Concerning the cauterization of fistulas in the tear duct of a wound.
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	When you treat a fistula using the methods discussed in the divisions of illnesses, and your treatment doesn't improve it, then you should cauterize it in this manner: instruct the patient to place their head on your lap, and have a servant hold their head between your hands, so that it's not jostled or moved by their head movements.
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	And then apply a piece of lint soaked in egg white or a poultice of plantain to the wound.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then apply the cautery, which is shaped like this:
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	which should be concave, shaped like a reed or a hawk's feather, at the end where the cautery is made.
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	And if desired, let it penetrate into the other end.
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	And if you want, let it be shaped like a probe.
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	However, the concave one is better for your work.
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	And then press on the fistula if it is open, and drain and dry it.
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	And if it is not open, then open it and remove the pus from it.
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	And then place the heated cautery on it, and hold your hand a little above the cautery near the opening of the nose, so that neither your hand nor the patient is disturbed. Then place the cautery on the edge of the opening and burn it away.
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	And so, if your cautery penetrates the bone at the beginning, good.  But if not, then repeat the cautery once or twice if necessary.  Leave it like this for three days, and then place a bandage over it with a poultice and surround it with a drying ointment until it is healed.
Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol.	But if more than ten days have passed and it is not healed, then apply a sharp corrosive medicine until the bone is exposed and smooth as is appropriate in its chapter.
E es autra manieyra de cauteri de fistula la qual alscus primiers diysero: enten al loc de la fistula e fen aquela e aprop pausa en aquela fissura camaen subtil del qual es la forma de lu: E fon en aquela la quantitat de i unc de plom fundut; e te la tua ma am camaem am bona retencio, e no sia maugut le malaute per so que le plom fundut no pervengua al huel de aquel; e cove que pausas sobre le huel del malaute coto enfus en album de huou o en aygua, quar plom adhureys le loc de la fistula e sana aquela per sanacio meravilhora.	And there is another way of cauterizing a fistula, which some earlier practitioners said:  Open the site of the fistula and then place in that fissure a thin, fine lead of which the form is thus:  Pour in that fissure about one inch of molten lead; hold your hand over it with a good grip, so that the patient is not moved lest the molten lead should reach the opening.  It is necessary to place over the patient's opening a bandage soaked in egg white or water, because the lead will adhere to the site of the fistula and heal it with astonishing speed.
E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.	And if the fistula is healed by what we have described about cauterization and treatment, it is well.  But if not, then it is necessary to administer a nasal incision and reduce the fistula to its proper place within the nasal cavity.
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter 18.
De cauterizacio de la fendedura des potz.	Concerning the cauterization of the fissure of the pot.  (Or, Concerning the cauterization of a fissure in the [part of the body associated with] the pot).
Motas veguadas accideysso fissuras en las labias, e majorment en las labias dels enfantz.	Often fissures occur in the lips, and especially on the lips of children.
Donc cum tu curas aquelas fissuras am aquo que nos havem dit en las divisios e no aprofieyta la tua cura, lahoras igneys le cauteri petit cutellar segon aquesta forma que s’ensiec:	Therefore, if you treat those fissures with what we have described in the divisions and your treatment is not effective, then heat the small, knife-like cautery in this manner described below:
E sia la conquavitat de lu segon la subtilitat de cotella.	And let its cavity be according to the sharpness of the knife.
Aprop pausa aquel init cuytadament en aquelas fissuras entro que·l cauteri pervengua al preon de las fissuras.	Then carefully place that heated cautery on those fissures until the cautery reaches the bottom of the fissures.
E aprop cura aquel am cerotz entro que sia sanat.	And then treat it with a plaster until it is healed.
Capitol .xix.	Chapter 19.
De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	Concerning the cauterization of fistulas in the mouth.
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	When an abscess forms at the base of the uvula, or on the palate, or at the roots of the teeth, and a boil develops, and then bursts, and then becomes chronic, and a fistula forms, and then you treat it and the treatment doesn't work, then you must cauterize it with fire according to the size of the opening in the fistula.  Then put that heated iron into the hole of the fistula, and hold your hand there until the heated iron reaches the bottom of it.  Do this one or two times.  Then treat it with the remedies we've discussed for healing until it is cured.
E donc si la sania es abscindita e es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari de descubrir le loc e hostar le os corrumput segon que vindra en son capitol.	And so, if the diseased tissue is cut away and healed, that is good; but if not, then it is necessary to uncover the area and remove the corrupted bone, as will be discussed in its own chapter.
Capitol .xx.	Chapter 20.
De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	Of cauterization of the teeth and softening of the gums.
Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.	When the gums are softened by moisture and the teeth are loose, and you treat them with medicines and it does not work, then place the patient's head on your lap, then heat the cautery, the shape of which will be described later, so that you place the tube over the tooth and quickly insert the heated cautery into it.  Hold your hand there briefly until the patient feels the heat of the fire reaching the root of the tooth.
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	And then remove your hand, and then repeat the cauterization several times as you wish.
E aprop le malaute huompla la sua boca de aygua de sal e tengua aquela per una hora, e pueys stupa aquela, quar la dent mauguda es fermada e la gengiva mollificada es strenguda e la humiditat corrompuda es exsiccada.	Then the patient should fill their mouth with salt water and hold it for an hour, and then spit it out. For the loose tooth will be fixed, the softened gums will be strengthened, and the corrupt moisture will be dried out.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter 21.
De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	Of cauterization for tooth pain.
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.	When tooth pain is due to cold, or there is cold or a worm in it, or medicine does not bring a cure, then cauterization there is done in two ways: either with a cow's hoof cautery or with fire.
Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	Cauterization with a hoof is done by taking a cow's hoof, boiling it in an iron container.  Then take a cloth, wrap it around the end of the probe, and dip that into the boiled hoof.  Then quickly place this over the aching tooth until it cools.
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	And repeat this several times until the heat's effect reaches the root of the tooth.
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.	And if you wish, dip wool or cloth in the aforementioned hoof, and place it over the aching tooth. Then place heated iron on top of that until the iron reaches the cavity of the tooth.
Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	However, cauterization with fire is done by using a heated iron or bronze instrument, and it should be of a certain thickness so the heat doesn't reach the patient's mouth.
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.	And then heat the cautery, shape it as needed, and place it on the tooth, holding it until it cools; repeat this a few times until the pain is gone, either that day or the next.
E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.	And it is necessary that, by pressure of this cautery, the patient fill their mouth with good broth and hold it for an hour, then spit it out; and this is the method of cauterization.
E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	And cauterize any extremity you can, as you see fit.
E aquesta es la forma de la cannula:	And this is the method of the cannula:
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter 22.
De cauterizacio de extrophulos.	Of the cauterization of extrophulos.
Quan extrophulos so de flecma e de humors fregas e no so hobedientz a digistio per medicinas e tu voys la digistio de aquelas leugerament, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri conquau la forma del qual es aquesta seguen, havent dos extremitatz hubertas per que yesca le fum deves le cauteri per l’autra extremitat, e pausa aquel ignit sobre aquel apostema una veguada, e autre si indigeyses de aquel, entro que pervengua al preon del apostema.	When extrophulos are of phlegm and cold humors, and are not yielding to digestion by medicines, and you desire a light digestion of them, then you heat the cautery, the shape of which is as follows, having two open ends so that smoke can escape from the cautery from the other end, and place this heated cautery on the abscess once, and again if necessary, until the inflammation of the abscess is reached.
E si l’apostema es pauca, lahoras pausa le cauteri segon la quantitat del apostema, e aprop leyssa le per tres jorns e pausa sobre lu coto enfus en boder entro que sia remaugut aquo que·l foc ha comburit.	And if the abscess is small, then place the cautery according to the size of the abscess, and then leave it for three days and place cotton soaked in broth over it until what the fire has burned is healed.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent e tentas e draps entro que sia sanat.	And then treat it with ointments, bandages, and dressings until it is healed.
E la forma de la cannula o deu cauteri a tal es comveyter.	And the shape of the cannula or cautery should be such as is fitting.
Capitol .xxiii.	Chapter 23.
De cauterizacio de rauquiera de votz e de constriccio de ale.	On the cauterization of hoarseness of the voice and constriction of the throat.
Quan las humiditatz veno sobre le quanal del pulmo, e majorment quan aquo es am fregiditat de compleccio, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia evacuat al comensament am medicinas laxativas, e aprop cauteriza aquel deves la razit del golayro en le loc depremegut.
