And then the phlebotomist anoints their lancet with a little old-fashioned oil; then places their left index finger on the vein, below the spot where they want to make the incision, so that the vein moves slightly, and the probing is halted; for of the veins, this one is the one you find similar to a fleeing string heading toward the incision, and from these, this one is full of air and, when you place the lancet on it, is drawn toward the incision, and the phlebotomist is warned; and the lancet does not open the vein, and if it does, it is constricted.

E es milhor en aquest loc que oli e que les autres olis.	And it is better in this case than other oils.

E la fleubotomia de aquesta vena es pus salva que de totas las autras venas, quar dejos lu no ha vena pulsatil, ni nervi.	And bloodletting from this vein is safer than from all other veins, for beneath it there is no pulsating vein, nor nerve.
E la fleubotomia de la savatella de la ma dreyta es conferent a las malautias del fetge.	And bloodletting from the vein in the right wrist is effective against ailments of the liver.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que tu strenguas la ma am liament o am la tua ma, pus que tu l’as mesa en ayga cauda, entro que la vena sia imflada e sia be demostrada al vezement; e aprop fleubotoma aquela transversan; e si inscidas aquela de tot no nozera aquo en re.	And the technique for bloodletting from this vein is that you hold the arm with a bandage or your hand, after you have placed it in warm water, until the vein swells and is clearly visible; then, make the incision across this vein; and if you cut it completely, it will do no harm.
E conserve que no ultimes la tua ma am la fleubotomi, quar dejos lu so les nervis dels ditz denudatz de carn.	And be careful not to cut too deep with your lancet, for below it are the nerves of the fingers, bare of flesh.
E aprop itera la ma en l’aygua cauda e laysse correr le sanc en aquela, quar si tu no iteras aquela en l’aygua cauda, le sanc sira coagulat en lo orrifici de la vena, e es prohibit de flux.	And then return the arm to the warm water and allow the blood to flow from it, for if you do not return it to the warm water, the blood will clot in the opening of the vein, and it will be prevented from flowing.
E cum es extrayt le sanc segon la quantitat de necessitat, lahoras tu pausa sobre la vena oli e sal, per que no sia consolidada coytadament; e semblantment cove que tu fassas en tot ram streyt.	And when the blood has been extracted to the desired amount, then place oil and salt on the vein so that it does not clot quickly; and similarly, you should do this for every vein you cut.
Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de aquela de la ma senestra, es que es conferent a las malautias de la melsa.	However, the benefit of bloodletting from the left arm is that it is beneficial for illnesses of the spleen.
E fay semblantment en la fleubotomia de lu ayssi cum has fayt en l’autra.	And do likewise in the bloodletting of him as you did in the other. (or, and do the same bloodletting on him as you did on the other.)
E le juvament de la vena sephena de la fleubotomia es a las malautias que so en la partida dejos del cos, ayssi cum so malautias de la mayre, e a retencio de mestruas, et a las malautias dels ronhos e ulceracios de coyssas e de cambas antiquas, e a lor semblantz de las malautias.	And the benefit of bloodletting from the saphenous vein is for illnesses that are in the lower part of the body, such as uterine problems, and retention of menses, and for ailments of the kidneys and ulcers of the thighs and legs that have been present for a long time, and similar illnesses.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute entrometa lo sieu pe en aygua cauda e fassa sobre aquel fricacio entro que be apparen las venas; e lia sobre la junctura del pe am correia; e le loc de la vena le talo apparent deves le dit pous, e de aquela so ramificatz en la facia del pe motz ramps.	And the procedure for bloodletting him is that the patient should put his foot in warm water and rub it until the veins appear clearly; and tie the joint of the foot with a bandage; and the place of the vein, which appears clearly near the said point, from there branches into many small veins on the surface of the foot.
E donc fleubotoma le pus ample ram o dejos la camba deves le talo deves la agreguacio de lu, quar es milhor e pus sal.	And therefore, make the incision on the widest vein, either below the leg towards the heel, or near its junction, because it is better and more effective.
E si fleubotomas aquela en la facia del pe, lahoras tu te guarda dels nervis que so dejos aquela sobre la facia del pe, e pausa la tua fleubotomia am la qual tu fleubotomas per le travers, quays cum si tu la volias inscidir.	And if you make the incision on the surface of the foot, then be mindful of the nerves that lie beneath the surface of the foot, and perform your bloodletting across the vein, as if you were trying to cut it in half/in two.
E sia le fleubotomi vosil.	And let the bloodletting be done carefully.
Mays si es prohibit le issiment del sanc; lahoras tu itera le pe de lu en l’aygua cauda e layssa correr le sanc en aquela entro que sia evacuat.	But if the removal of blood is prohibited, then you should repeatedly immerse the patient's foot in warm water and allow the blood to flow out until it has been evacuated.
E si le fleubotomador erra en la primieyra veguada, lahoras itera am le fleubotomi en sus un pauc, quar le loc es sal; e no temes de lu malician, mays que te guardes dels nervis ayssi cum havem dit.	And if the bloodletter errs on the first attempt, then repeat the bloodletting a little further in, because the area is effective/suitable; and do not fear harming the patient, but rather be careful of the nerves, as we have said.
E semblantment fay de la sophena del autre pe engualment.	And similarly, do the same for the corresponding area on the other foot as well.
E de la vena sciatica, le loc ayssi cum havem dit es deves le talo dejos la cavilha de la partida silvestra.	And for the sciatic vein, the location, as we have said, is below the heel, beneath the bone of the outside/lateral part.
E le juvament de la fleubotomia de lu es a dolo de anca quan es per sanc caut.	And the remedy for the bloodletting of this, is for hip pain when it's due to hot blood.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute intre en banh, e festine e strenha la cueyssa de lu del latz de la ancha entro desus le talo desus quatre ditz an una benda longua subtil, quar no appar sino per aquo.	And the procedure for the bloodletting is that the patient enters a bath, and swiftly and tightly wraps their thigh from the groin area up to above the heel with a long, thin bandage for four days, because it appears only from this.
E donc quan appar, lahoras tu fleubotoma aquela segon cascun engen que es a tu possible e segon le tranvers, e es milhor; o inscidas aquela per inscizio o secces aquela per seccio, quar le loc de lu es sal.	And then, when it appears, you should perform the bloodletting according to whatever method is possible for you and the position of the vein, and this is better; either cut it with incision or with a section, for the area is salty/affected.
E ela es en motz homes mot ameguada; e si atrobas aquela, e no appar al sentiment de tot, lahoras fleubotoma alcun ram de lu, e es aquel que appar en le dos del pe enves le dit auricular e le anular.	And it is very hidden in many men; and if you find it, and it does not appear to the touch, then bleed a branch of it, and that is the one that appears on the back of the foot next to the so-called auricular and annular (or ring-shaped) regions.
E guarda te dels nervis, e fay correr del sanc la quantitat que voles.	And beware of the nerves, and let the blood flow in the quantity you desire.
E aprop deslia la strictura e pausa sobre le loc de la fleubotomia coto e strenh le loc, quar leugierament es sanat.	And then loosen the constriction and place a compress over the bloodletting site and bind the area tightly, for it will heal quickly.
De ventozacio e de las qualitatz de uzar de aquelas.	Of cupping and the qualities of using them.
Ventozas so de corns, o de eram, o de veyre.	Cupping is done with horns, or with leather, or with glass.
E ventozacio es fayta segon doas manieyras: la una de lor es am scarificacio e extracio de sanc, e l’autra es ventozacio ses scarificacio.	And cupping is done in two ways: one of them is with incision and extraction of blood, and the other is cupping without incision.
E aquesta ventozacio que es ses scarificacio es segon doas manieyras, quar o es am foc o ses foc.	And this cupping without incision is done in two ways, for it is either with fire or without fire.
E a las ventozas que so administradas am scarificacio e extraccio de sanc son xiiii locs del cors, dels quals la un en lo qual so pausadas ventozas es alnocrati, e es la deriera partida del cap; e le mieg loc d’el de doas partz del col ensemp; e ventozas del mento dejos la mandibula pus dejos de la boca; e ventozas de doas spatulas; e ventozas de alohoster, e es sobre la fi de la coeta; e ventozas de dos focils, e so de dos brasses; e ventozas de doas cavilhas; e ventozas de doas cuoyssas.	And for cupping that is administered with incision and blood extraction, there are fourteen places on the body, of which one place where cupping is placed is at the nape of the neck, and it is the rear part of the head; and in the middle is the space between the two sides of the neck together; and cupping of the chin under the jaw, then below the mouth; and cupping on both shoulder blades; and cupping on the shoulder blades, and it is at the end of the shoulder blade; and cupping on the two elbows, and on both arms; and cupping on the two knees; and cupping on the two thighs.
E ventozacio no extratz le sanc sino de las venas menudas sparssas en la carn, e per aquo no catz la vertut per aquelas, ayssi cum es cazement per fleubotomia; ni no cove que ventozacio sia fayta am foc o ses foc en alcuna malautia fayta per replecio entro que le cors tot sia evacuat.	And cupping does not extract blood from the large veins, but from the small, scattered veins in the flesh, and therefore it does not diminish the vital force as occurs with bloodletting; nor should cupping with or without fire be performed for any illness caused by fullness until the entire body is evacuated.
Mays si necessitat provoca a ventozacio per malautia o per continua, aministrem aquela en tota hora al comensament del mes e en la fi de lu, e en le mieg loc de lu e en qualque temps sia.	However, if need compels cupping for an illness or for a continuous ailment, administer it at any time, at the beginning of the month and at the end, in the middle of it, and at any time.
La qual causa es quar dels homes es en les quals es sanc multiplicat entro que indigeys de extraccio de lu per ventozacio e atroba en le sieu cap graveza e soda; e de aquels es que atroba replecio e rogor en la sua cara e en le sieu cap, e en le sieu col; e de aquels es que atroba pruziment en la sua cara e en le sieu front e tenebrositat e hebetut en les sieus huels; e de aquels que gieta le loc de la sua ventozacio; e de aquels es que le lor ris es multiplicat; e de aquels es que atroba gustament de sanc en la sua boca, o que la lengua es apostemada e escup sanc; e de aquels es que lor dormir es multiplicat, e de aquels que vetz sanc en lo dormir rogor e antics e plaguas e autras causas a lor semblantz.	Which condition occurs when blood is multiplied in a person to the point where they require blood extraction through cupping, and they experience heaviness and tightness in their head; and of these, one experiences fullness and stiffness in their face and head and neck; and of these, one experiences redness in their face and forehead and dullness and sluggishness in their eyes; and of these, one experiences swelling in the area of their cupping; and of these, one experiences increased thirst; and of these, one experiences a salty taste in their mouth, or their tongue is ulcerated and spits blood; and of these, their sleep is increased, and of these they see blood in their dreams, stiffness, sores, and other similar conditions.
E donc quan vezes en alcuna causa de aquelas, e propriament si es en le tertz o miga del mes, lahoras comandam ventozacio esser fayta pus que so passadas del dia dos o tres horas.	Therefore, when any of these conditions occur, and particularly if it is in the third or middle part of the month, then we command that cupping be performed after two or three hours have passed.
E juvament de ventozacio de la nuca es que quan aquela confereys a gravitat en le cap e ad aquo que es efondit als huels; mays cove que aquo sia aprop evacuacio de tot le cors.	The benefit of cupping the neck is that it alleviates heaviness in the head and what is pressing on the eyes; however, this should be followed by the evacuation of the entire body.
E aquesta ventoza es en le loc de fleubotomia de la cephalica.	And this cupping is in the location of the cephalic vein's bloodletting.
E no es legut que use de lu aquel que es de frega complecio, o en le qual es catarr, quar dona ad aquel gran nocument.	And it is not permitted for someone with a cold or one with a catarrh to use it, for it causes them great harm.
E per aquo no cove que uso de aquela les vielhs, e en les caps dels quals so malautias frejas.	Therefore, it is not suitable for the elderly to use it, and those whose heads are afflicted with cold illnesses.
Mays ad aquel que sobre aquela es continuant sobre lu es fayta oblivio; e per aquo cove que tu comandes al ventozador que depause la sua ma un petit am la ventosa a las partidas dejos, temen de la generacio de oblivio.	However, for the person who is continually being treated with it, it is made ineffective; therefore, you should instruct the cupper to slightly reposition the cup downwards in the affected areas, fearing the creation of ineffectiveness.
Mays ventozacio de alkehel es en loc de fleubotomia de la vena fusca e de la basilica: e per aquo confereys a asma, e a la constriccio de ale e a la scissura del sturment de ale, e a tos, e a replecio.	But cupping with alcohol is in the location of bloodletting from the vena fusca and the basilica veins: and therefore, it is applied to asthma, and constriction of the breath and the tearing of the windpipe, and to coughs, and congestion.
E cove que sia enpellida la ventoza alkehel un petit, quar si es pausada dejos, engendra debilitat en le cors e en le stomac.	And the alcohol cupping should be raised slightly, for if it is placed too low, it will generate weakness in the body and the stomach.
E la ventozacio de alhagdahan confereys a las dolors accident en le cap e a obtalmia, e emigranea, e prefocacio, e a dolors en las razitz de las dentz; e es en loc de fleubotomia de la basiliqua.	And cupping with *alhagdahan* is used for accidental pains in the head, and for ophthalmia, migraine, and feverishness, and for pains in the roots of the teeth; and it is a substitute for bloodletting from the basilica vein.
E cove que comandes al ventozador que no prema la sua ma am scarificacio per que no inscida la arteria e accida fluxs de sanc.	And you should instruct the cupper not to press with too much force using a scalpel, so that he does not cut the artery and cause a flow of blood.
E ventozacio dejos le mento comfereys a alcola en la boca, e a corrupcio de la gingiva, e a semblantz a lor de las malautias que so en la boca, e stan en loc de fleubotomia de aliheric que so en las doas labias.	And cupping below the chin is beneficial for sores in the mouth, and for gum rot, and similar mouth ailments, and it is a substitute for bloodletting of the veins that are in both lips.

E la ventosacio de las doas partidas dedintz dels focils confereys juvament de la fleubotomia de tres venas, so es de la basilica, fusca e cephalica, quar aquela atratz le sanc de totas aquelas venas pus manudas que so en la carn, e aquelas venas menudas de las autras venas pus grossas entro que pervengua la atraccio a las tres venas.	And cupping on both sides inside the hollows [of the armpits] is a helpful substitute for bloodletting from three veins, namely the basilica, the cephalic, and the brachial, because it draws blood from all the smaller veins in the flesh and those smaller veins draw blood from the larger ones until the drawing is done to the three main veins.
E comanda al ventozador que trop no procezesca en scarificacio, quar le loc es denudat de carn, e dejos lu so nervis e arterias.	And instruct the cupper not to proceed too deeply with the incision, because the area is lacking in flesh, and beneath it are nerves and arteries.
E es una ventoza am la qual es ventozat sobre alshosses e confereys a las emorroydas del cul e a las ulceracios pus dejos.	And a cupping treatment applied to the buttocks is beneficial for hemorrhoids and ulcers in the lower rectum.
E cove que comandes al ventozador que sia gran ventoza, e que sia de eram, quar le loc indigeys de fort seccio; e fort leu so traucadas ventozas subtils e sia scarificat am scarificacio.	And you should tell the cupper to use a large, leather cupping glass, because the area needs a strong suction;  thin, easily pierced cupping glasses are ineffective and should be avoided, along with superficial incisions.
Mays ventozas de las cambas minueysso per minuicio manifesta, quar atiran le sanc de tot le cors, e comfereysso a dolors antiquas dels ronhos e de la mayre, e de la vesica; e provocan las mestruas, e comfereysso a bothor e ademil; e stan en loc de fleubotomia de doas sophenas, e alahorcoben, e de doas cavilhas.	However, cupping on the legs is less effective, because it draws blood from the entire body, and it is helpful for chronic pains in the kidneys, liver, and bladder; it stimulates menstruation, and is helpful for fever and exhaustion; it stands in place of bloodletting from two jugular veins, and in place of drawing with two leaches.
Enpero mot debelitan tot le cors e fan accidir sincopi en motz homes.	However, it weakens the entire body and can cause fainting in many people.
E de las ventozas alahorcoben le juvament es propda al juvament a las ventozas de doas cambas.	And the benefit from cupping is comparable to the benefit of cupping both legs.
E la qualitat de la posicio de las ventozas es que pauses la ventoza al comensament vueda e sucguas per succio temprada, e no prolongues la posicio de las ventozas, mays pausa aquelas leugierament, e reman aquelas coytadament, e que las humors venguan al loc per adveniment engual.	And the method for applying the cupping is to place the empty cupping glass initially and gently draw a moderate suction.  Do not prolong the application of the cupping glasses, but instead place them lightly and remove them quickly, so that the humors move to the area.
E no cesses iterar aquo e continuar entro que veja le loc ja enrojezir e inflar e que appara la rogor del sanc.	And do not stop repeating this and continuing until you see the area reddened and swollen and the blood vessels appear.
E lahoras tu scarifiqua e itera la succio pauc a pauc, e aprop considera en la dispozicio dels cors.	And then you make incisions and repeat the suction gradually, and then consider the condition of the patient's body.
Quar aquel home que es de tendra carn de rars pors, cove que tu le scarifiques una veguada e no pus, per que le loc no sia ulcerat.	For a person with delicate, sensitive skin, you should make a single incision, and no more, to avoid ulceration of the area.
E comanda al ventozador que amplifique la scarificacio e pronde un pauc, e atempre la succio am facilitat.	And instruct the cupper to enlarge the incision slightly, and to regulate the suction with ease.
E si en le sanc es grossitut, lahoras cove que scarifiques doas veguadas, quar en la primieyra veguada es uberta la via de subtiliacio al sanc e a la aquositat de lu.	And if the blood is thick, then you should make two incisions, for in the first one, the path for the blood and its watery component is opened.
Mays en la segunda a la perscrutacio aquisida de la extraccio del sanc gros.	But in the second, the examination gains the extraction of the thick blood.
E si le sanc es mot feculent, lahoras sia fayta scarificacio la tersa veguada per que consiegua le derier.	And if the blood is very impure, then a third incision should be made to achieve the final result.
E derierament, quan volem extrayre le sanc pauc a pauc o un petit, abasta a nos una scarificacio.	And finally, when we want to extract a little blood gradually, a single incision is sufficient.
E si volem extraccio de mot sanc, scarificam am mota scarificacio; e si nos conoyssem que·l sanc es gros, lahoras cove que scarifiquem per scarificacio preonda.	And if we want to extract a lot of blood, we make many incisions; and if we know the blood is thick, then we need to make deep incisions.
E le terme de scarificacio en la qual es la profunditat de la codena tant solament.	And the term for incision where the depth is only the length of the gouge.
E si aquel del qual la codena es grossa, dura, fusca, e les sieus pors so streytz, cove que les locs de las ventosas sian untatz lenitius, apertius resolutius; si es en temps d’estiu, ayssi cum es oli de aloen o oli de violat, o oli de amellas dossas, o oli de cemensa de coja; e si es en temps ivern, lahoras oli narci, o oli de liri, o oli de camamilla, o de sanc, e ad aquels semblantz.	And if the affected area has a thick, hard, dark complexion, and its pores are tight, the places for the cupping glasses should be rubbed with softening, opening, and dissolving remedies; if it's summer, use oil of almonds, or oil of violets, or oil of mild myrrh, or oil of quince seed; and if it's winter, use narcissus oil, or lily oil, or chamomile oil, or bloodroot oil, and similar ones.
E si la superfluitat es grossa, freja, lahoras le oli sia amaranti, o oli de balsamita, o oli de aloen, o oli aneti, e a lor semblantz.	And if the superfluity is thick and cold, then use oil of marjoram, or oil of balm, or oil of almond, or dill oil, and similar ones.
Mays si le ventozador es de amples pors de tendra carn, lahoras cove que sia prohibit de oli, e cove que ad aquest les locs de ventozas de lor aprop la ventozacio sian lavatz am ayguaros o am aygua freja de solatrum, o am aygua de coja, o am aygua de bordolaguas, e semblantz ad aquelas.	But if the patient has wide pores and tender flesh, then oil should be avoided, and the areas around the cupping glasses should be washed with cool water, or water from the plant Solanum, or quince water, or water from the plant Borrago, and similar liquids.
E aquel del qual le sanc es de mota humiditat, lava las suas ventozas am vi agre, o am aygua de mirt e sumac e semblant ad aquels.	And for those whose blood is moist and watery, wash their cupping glasses with sour wine, or with water of myrtle and sumac, and similar things.
E de aquel del qual las superfluitatz son grossas, lava las suas ventozas am vi antic, o am aygua de sansuc, que es majorana, o de decoccio de anet, o de camamilla, e a lor semblantz.	And for those whose superfluities are thick, wash their cupping glasses with old wine, or with water of plantain (likely a reference to a specific type of plantain, not the common one), or with an infusion of dill, or chamomile, and similar remedies.
E cove que la ventozacio sia guardada denant de banh; habantz cove que sia aministrada aprop issiment del banh per una hora o per doas, e cove que dorma aprop la ventozacio.	And the cupping should be avoided before a bath; if taken, it should be administered shortly before the bath, for an hour or two, and the patient should rest after the cupping.
Quid est quo oportet ut regatur ventosandus aus phlebotomatus ante ventosationem.	What is that which ought to be regulated for the cupping or bloodletting before the cupping?
Cove que consideras al comensament: lahoras si le ventozador o aquel que·s deu fleubotomar es coleric e ventz sobre lu sanc agut e imflamacio, lahoras cove que prengua causas infrigidantz, ayssi cum milgranas acetosas, e endivia an vi agre e laytuguas, e secanabin, e julep, e a lor semblantz.	One should consider at the outset: if the person being cupped or bled is choleric and has sharp, inflammatory blood, then it is necessary for them to take things that cool the blood, such as pickled mulberries, endive in sour wine, lettuce, and drying substances like cumin, julep, and similar remedies.
E pausa a lor viandas ayssi cum poletz, e carns de auzels serbiges, e viandas conditas am agras, e a lu semblantz.	And restrict their food to things like herbs, tender fowl meat, and dishes seasoned with sour ingredients, and similar foods.
E de aquel del qual la compleccio es freja, cove que prengua en beure eyssarop almiva, o eyssarop de alsecanabin de semensas, e sumac, e vi mot odorant migier entre viel et noel; e que a lu sia comendat que use de paucitat de beure e de mangar, e pausa las viandas de lu poletz e canabir e pissers e petitz auzels e colombat.	And for someone with a cold constitution, they should drink licorice syrup, or syrup made from cannabis seeds, sumac, and very fragrant wine (somewhere between old and new); they should be advised to consume little food and drink, and their diet should include herbs, hemp, small birds, and pigeons.
E cove que en lo dia de ventozacio e de fleubotomia le beure sia major que la vianda.	And it is necessary that on the day of cupping and bloodletting, the amount of drink should be greater than the amount of food.
E cove que sia donat en beure en alcunas horas ad alcus homes tyriaca alpharac, o medicamentz de musc, so es muscada, o alcelita denant la ventozacio o denant fleubotomia o aprop, per so que·ls membres principals sian confortatz e que·l sanc sia subtiliat; e no cove que prenguan aquela scalfatz.	And it is necessary to give certain people, at certain times, theriac alpharac, or musk-based remedies (i.e., musk, or ambergris) before cupping or bloodletting, or shortly thereafter, so that the principal members of the body are strengthened and the blood is refined; and they should not take these remedies when heated.
Mays las ventozas que so ses scarificacio sian ventozas que so pausadas sus le fetge, e sobre la melsa e podagra, e sobre le umbelic, en les locs dels jonolhs, e la pixida del ancha, quar aquestz membres no suffertan scarificacio sobre si.	However, cupping without scarification should be applied to the liver, spleen, gout, navel, knee areas, and the lower back, since these areas cannot tolerate scarification.
E no es querit per aquelas sino atraccio de sanc de membre, ayssi cum pausam ventosa sobre mamilha en malautia de flux de sanc del sanc de las nars; e usam de aquela per que sia dissolvuda ventositat freja inviscade del membre, ayssi cum pausam sobre le ventre e l’umbelic; quar aquela rarifique le membre e scalfa lu e ramau la dolor quar resolveys ventositat.	And this is not sought for anything other than the drawing of blood from a limb, just as we place a cupping glass on the nipple in cases of nosebleeds; and we use it to dissolve cold, stagnant air from the limb, just as we place it on the abdomen and navel; because it thins the limb, warms it, and relieves the pain by resolving the stagnant air.
E ja es pausada sobre les ronhos quan accideys en lor opilacio o poyra, quar per vertut de atraccio fort leu huobre opilacio e erradica le poyra de son loc.	And it is already placed on the kidneys when they are congested or have a blockage, for by the virtue of strong suction, it quickly relieves congestion and removes the blockage from its location.
E semblantment fa quan es pausada sobre le fetge e la melsa deves ventositat en aquels enclausa.	Similarly, it works when placed on the liver and spleen to remove the stagnant air contained within them.
E aquestas ventozas so administradas vuedas amb succio tant solament; e alcunas veguadas so administradas am foc.	And these cupping glasses are administered empty, with suction only; and sometimes they are administered with fire.
E alcunas veguadas so administradas plenas de aygua tebeza en las malautias de la melsa.	And sometimes they are administered full of warm water in diseases of the spleen.
E aquo es per que la ventoza sia umplida e sia pus gran, so es aygua cauda sola o aygua en la qual sian cuytas herbas ad aquo convenientz.	And this is so that the cupping glass is filled and larger, either with just warm water, or water in which herbs suitable for this purpose have been boiled.
Forma de ventoza aministrada am foc: sia la amplitud del orrifici de dos ditz, segon que nos la havem formada; e la quantitat del preon sia la maytat de un palm; e sia en lo latz de lu, en le loc que es en le circuit, la maytat de lu, le trauc sia petit segon la quantitat que intre en lu una agulha.	The form of a cupping glass administered with fire:  the opening should be about two fingers wide, as we have formed it; and the quantity of the heat should be about half a palm; and it should be on the patient's back, in the area of the back that is halfway around, the opening should be small enough that only a needle could fit through it.
Sia fayta de eram rog o citri, de grosses marges, leon, enguals e terses per so que no leda le membre deves la sua posicio sobre lu.	It should be made of red or citrus wood, with thick, strong, and smooth edges so that it does not damage the body part it is placed upon.
E sia al mieg de lu vergua transversa de eram o de ferr, on es pausada candela am lo foc.	And in the middle of it there should be a transverse rod of wood or iron, upon which a candle is placed with the fire.
E ja sia aquesta ventoza gran major de aquela la qual havem recomtat; e la pauca mendre de aquela segon las malautias e la etat de aquel que usa de aquela.	And this cupping glass should be larger than the one we have described; and the smaller one should be smaller, depending on the illness and the age of the user.
E las ventosas dels efantz e extenuatz so autres que las ventozas dels joves e de grosses corssas.	The cupping glasses for children and the weakened are different from those for young people and those with strong bodies.
E la qualitat de pausar aquesta ventoza am foc sobre le membre es que extenda la meca am foc de lenha decentment denant una pauca candela de cera, e pausa aquela sobre le mieg de la vergua transversa en le mieg loc de la ventoza, per que le foc sia accendut enviro la partida dejos per que no sia comburit le cors del malaute.	And the quality of applying this cupping glass with fire to the body part is to extend the fire with firewood properly before a small beeswax candle, and place that on the middle of the transverse rod in the middle of the cupping glass, so that the fire is ignited around the area underneath, so that the patient's body is not burned.
E aprop sia pausada sobre le membre del malaute, e le dit sia sobre le trauc que havem dit, entro que quan tenem las ventozas e non indigem que osten le dit e que yesca la vapor sobre aquel trauc, lahoras la ventoza sira tantost dissolvuda.	And then it should be placed on the patient's body part, and the finger should be on the hole we mentioned, until, when we have the cupping glasses and we don't want the finger to be exposed and the vapor to escape through that hole, then the cupping glass will quickly be dissolved.
E prop igneys la meca segon la sua manieyra, e itera aquela si indigeyssas de aquela.	And ignite the fire according to its manner, and repeat it if you need it.
Mays en ventosa que es aministrada en la malautia de plauressi, am aygua, en la qual no ha vergua transversa ni trauc, e no es aministrada sino que sia umplida de aygua, e es pausada sobre le membre tant solament.	But a cupping glass administered for a disease of pleurisy, with water, in which there is no transverse rod or hole, and it is not administered except that it be filled with water, and is placed on the body part only.
E aquesta es la forma de lu: E aquesta ventoza quant plus es gran, tant es milhor, per que puya recebre gran quantitat de aygua.	And this is its form: And the larger this cupping glass is, the better, so that it can receive a large quantity of water.
Capitol .xcvii.	Chapter 97.
Sanguissuguas no so administradas en motz membres sino en les membres en les quals non es possible posicio de ventosas, per la parvitat de aquels, ayssi cum le pot e gingiva e semblantz a lor; o en membre denudat de carn, ayssi cum le dit e·l nas e lors semblantz.	Leeches are not administered to many limbs, but only to those limbs where cupping is not possible, due to their small size, like the foot, and the gums, and similar parts; or to limbs devoid of flesh, like the finger and nose and similar parts.
E la qualitat de usar de aquelas que si has trobadas sanguisugas que so en las ayguas dossas de poyredura mundas.	And the quality of using those leeches that you have found in clean, clear, muddy waters.
E aprop sian layssadas le dia e la nueyt en aygua dossa entro que sian famolentas, e que no romangua alcuna causa en le ventre de aquelas; e aprop sia evacuat le cors en le comensament am fleubotomia e am ventozas; e aprop fregua le membre del malaute entro que s’enrojezesca; e aprop sian pausadas sobre lu.	And afterwards, they [the leeches] should be left in clean, fresh water overnight until they are hungry, and no remnants remain in their stomachs; and subsequently, the body should be evacuated at the beginning with bloodletting and cupping; and then the patient's limb should be rubbed until it reddens; and then the leeches should be placed on it.
E cum son umplidas e caso.	And when they are full and fall off.
E si es possible succio del loc am ventoza, es mays derier en juvament.	And if suction from the area is possible using a cupping vessel, it is better afterwards in terms of treatment.
E sino, lahoras lava le loc am vi agre e aprop am mota aygua; e sia freguat e expremut.	And if not, then wash the area with vinegar and then with plenty of water; and rub and squeeze it.
E si es prolonguat le cors del sanc aprop le cazement de las sanguissuguas, e es aquo resudan, lahoras tu enfon un drap de li en aygua freja, e pausa aquel de sobre entro que sia abdida la resudacio.	And if the body of blood is prolonged around the placement of the leeches, and it is oozing, then you should dip a cloth in cold water and place it over the area until the oozing is stopped.
E si le sanc es multiplicat, lahoras polveriza sobre lu vitriol trissat, o guallas e semblantz a lor de las causas stipticas, entro que·l sanc sia abscidit; o sian pausadas sobre le loc las maytatz de favas excocicadas, e sian layssadas entro que las favas aderescan al loc, e es le sanc abscidit.	And if the blood is excessive, then sprinkle powdered vitriol or other similar astringent substances upon it until the blood is stopped; or place roasted chickpea halves over the area, and leave them until the chickpeas adhere to the spot, and the blood is stopped.
E cove, si es necessaria, iteracio de sanguissuguas, quan es possible mudar aquelas.	And if necessary, repeat the use of leeches, when it's possible to change them.
E si las sanguissuguas son prohibidas de suspenssio, lahoras sia freguat le loc am sanc recent o fique una agulha en les locs entro que yesca sanc; e aprop sian pausadas, quar aquelas quan sento alcun sanc tantost adarysso.	And if the leeches are prohibited from being used, then rub the area with fresh blood or pierce it with a needle until blood comes out; and then apply them, because these leeches, when they sense any blood, immediately adhere.
E quan voles que cajan, polveriza sobre aquelas un pauc de aloen trissat, o sal, o cendre, e cazo tantost.	And when you want them to release, sprinkle a little crushed aloes, or salt, or ash on them, and they will fall off immediately.
Ayssi comensa lo prolec de la tersa partida: de restauracio.	Thus begins the treatment of the third part: of restoration.
Aquest capitol es motas veguadas necessari en la art de medicina; e es restauracio de fractura e de dislocacio accident en les osses.	This chapter is very necessary in the art of medicine; and it is the restoration of fractures and dislocations that accidentally occur in the bones.
O, filh, sapiatz que jactan se de aquest capitol les fols metges e les vulguars e aquels que degun temps no reguardero les libres dels Antics ni legiro de aquels una letra.	O, son, know that foolish and vulgar physicians, and those who have never looked into the books of the ancients or read a single letter from them, boast about this chapter.
E per aquesta causa es fayt que aquesta manieyra dels scients in terra nostra es privat; e yeu no ho e obliat en aquo degun temps be de tot; e no he adhibit aquo que apres, sino per longitut de lectio dels libres dels Antics e studi sobre le entendement de aquels, entro que extrayssi la sciencia de aquels.	And for this reason, this method of the learned ones in our land is private; and I have not forgotten this at all; and I have not embraced this, but only through a long study of the books of the ancients and study of their meaning, until I extracted their science.
E aprop adirigui a experiment e studi en la longitut de la mieua vida.	And from now on I dedicate myself to experimentation and study throughout my life.
E yeu ja he de aquo descrit en aquest capitol tot aquo que conte la mieua sciencia e sobre le qual es passat lo mieu experiment; pus que agui abreujat aquo a vos autres e deliuregui aquo de occupacio de elonguacio; e abreujegui aquo en la fi de abreujacio; et e monstrat aquo en la fi de declaracio; e formegui en aquo motas formas dels sturmentz que so administratz en aquel, cum es fayt per addicio de declaracio, ayssi cum he fayt en dos capitols precedentz.	And I have already described in this chapter everything that my knowledge contains and upon which my experience has been tested; since I have shortened this for you, and freed it from lengthy explanations; and condensed it at the end of the condensation; and shown it at the end of the explanation; and formed many forms of the instruments used in this, as was done by adding explanations, as I have done in the two previous chapters.
Capitol primier.	First Chapter.
Summae et collectiones ex esse fracturae ossium, ex eis quarum praemissio necessaria est, antequam incipiamus rememorationem membrorum fraftorum et diversorum si uniuscuiusque.	A summary and collection of the essential elements for understanding bone fractures, before we begin to discuss the treatment of broken limbs and their diverse types.
Cove donc que diguam en le prohemi de aquest capitol las summas del sermo; e les capitols al entendament dels quals en le comensament es forsat le artifexs e a stacio sobre la veritat de aquels; so es vos e aquels que so promptz que sapian o aprenguan aquesta art nobla autres de vos.	Therefore, let us begin this chapter with a summary of the subject; and the topics, understanding which is essential for practitioners at the outset and for upholding the truth of those things; that is to say, you and those who are eager to learn this noble art, whether they are your students or others.
E donc dic que quan accideys a alcu fractura o dislocacio o torcio o cazement, lahoras cove que tu te coytes al comensament am fleubotomia o aleyar aquel, o quascu ensemps, si no prohibeys alcuna causa, ayssi cum debelitat de vertut, o es aquel al qual accideys effant, o viel en decrepitat, o es temps de vehement calor, o de vehement freg.	And therefore I say that when an accident of fracture, dislocation, twisting, or crushing occurs, then it is necessary to begin with phlebotomy or to alleviate the situation, or both together, unless some reason prevents you, such as weakness, or the person is a child, or old and frail, or it is a time of intense heat or intense cold.
E aprop sia content en vianda sieua de erbas frejas e de carns de auzels e de crabotz; e prohibem carns grossas e umplir si de viandas e de tota vianda que umple las venas de sanc, entro que siras segurat de apostema caut, e si no temes efusio de materia al membre.	And afterwards, let their diet consist of fresh herbs and the flesh of birds and rabbits; and forbid them fatty meats and foods that fill them up, and any food that overfills the veins with blood, until you are sure of a suppurating boil, and if you do not fear a discharge of matter onto the limb.
E lahoras retorne le malaute al sieu regiment primier am le qual corr costuma de lu.	And then, return the patient to their original regimen, the one they were accustomed to.
E donc cum le os trencat comensa esser restaurat, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia pascut de viandas nutritivas de nutriment mot e gros e greu en les quals sia viscositat, ayssi cum so viandas faytas de froment cueyt am aygua, e ris, e caps, e pes, e ventres de vacas, e huous, e peys fresc, e vi gros e semblants ad aquels, e am aquest regiment es fayta coagulacio de fractura pus leugierament e miels.	And therefore, once the broken bone begins to be restored, then the patient must eat nutritious foods, substantial, thick and heavy foods with viscosity, such as cooked wheat with water, rice, broth, calves' feet, eggs, fresh fish, and thick wines similar to these; and with this regimen, the fracture heals more easily and better.
E sapias que les osses trinquatz quan so en les homes que so en la primiera vilura e en los decrepitz, no es possible que sian continuatz e sian consolidatz segon lur natura per la exsiccacio dels membres de lor.	And know that broken bones in the elderly and the frail, in their initial injury, cannot be made whole and properly consolidated because of the wasting away of their limbs.
E son consolidatz e continuatz segon lor natura tot temps per la exsiccacio de aquels membres, e so continuatz e consolidatz aquels que so de lor en la fi de la lenitat, ayssi cum les osses dels petitz effantz.	And they are properly consolidated and made whole at all times through the drying of those limbs, and those that are in the prime of their youth, like the bones of small children, are likewise made whole and consolidated.
Mays empero natura ajusta e amnecteys sobre le os trencat de tota partida alcuna causa semblant a glut en le qual es grossitut que adhereys e strenh aquel entro que so ensemps conglutinatz e liatz ensemps, entro que venen la fi de fortitut e de fermesa, ayssi cum foc al comensament, entro que denguna causa no prohibeys aquel de las suas obres.	However, nature joins and brings together around the broken bone from all sides a substance similar to glue, thick and adhering, that binds it tightly until it is completely joined and united, until it reaches the point of strength and firmness, just as a fire does at the start, until any factor prevents it from continuing its work.
E per aquesta causa es necessari que pauses las viandas del malaute, viandas en las quals so gravitat e viscozitat e grosseza, ayssi cum havem dit.	And for this reason, it is necessary to provide the patient with foods that are heavy, viscous, and thick, as we have said.
Mota diversitat de fractura segon diversitat del membre.	There is a variety of fractures according to the variety of the limb.
E sapias que las specias de fractura son diversas segon la diversitat dels membres, quar fractura del os de la camba es diversa de la fractura del os del cap; e la fractura del os del pietz es divers de la fractura del os del dos; e semblantment totz les autres membres son diverses entre lor.	And know that the types of fractures vary according to the diversity of the limbs, for a fracture of the leg bone is different from a fracture of the head bone; and a fracture of the foot bone is different from a fracture of the arm bone; and similarly, all the other limbs have different types of fractures.
E yeu venc am rememoracio de tota specia de fractura, expausada en le sieu capitol distincta del autre.	And I come with a reminder of every kind of fracture, explained in its own separate chapter.
Mota diversitat de fractura en si meteyssa.	There is a diversity of fractures within themselves.
E son diversificadas las specias de fractura del os en lor meteyssas; quar es fayta fractura arcuada otra aquo que accidan en lu stellas; e alcunas veguadas es fayta fractura segon la longitut del os: e so las fracturas de lu satagia e astelhas e addicios procedentz e no-procedentz, ayssi cum es fayt en la pena quan es preparada a escriure, e es fractura am plagua e disrupcio en le cap, e es fractura fissura petita.	And the types of bone fractures themselves are diverse; for there is a curved fracture, and others that occur in star-like patterns; and sometimes a fracture occurs along the length of the bone:  and these are the fractures called transverse, oblique, and compound/complicated [referring to open fractures], just as is the case with a pen when it is being prepared to write.  And there are fractures with a gap/separation and a crack/disruption to the head, and there are small fissure fractures.
E a tota specia es engen o turment propri en restauracio de lu segon que vindra rememoracio de lu distincta en les sieus locs.	And for every type, there is a specific treatment or remedy in restoring it, according to the specific reminder of it in its respective places.
Mota senhal de fractura del os.	A sign of a bone fracture.
E per aquo es conoguda fractura del os: es tortuositat de lu, e de aquel eminencia e appericio de lu al sentiment, e so de lu quan compremes aquel am la tua ma.	And by this a bone fracture is recognized: it is a twisting of the bone, and a prominence and appearance of it to the sense, and this is of it when you grasp it with your hand.
E donc quan no es en le loc tortuositat apparent ni so no es feyt deves le tieu tocament quan toques le os am agitacio e le malaute no atroba gran dolor, lahoras no es aqui fractura.	And therefore, when there is no apparent twisting in the bone, nor is it painful upon your touch when you press the bone with pressure, and the patient does not experience great pain, then there is no fracture here.
Habantz es possible que sia tortuositat o petita fissura, adon no cove que tu mauguas aquel am la tua ma e am compressio de tot; habantz pausa sobre lu de las medicinas de las quals ve rememoracio aprop aquel moment le qual conveneys al loc; e aprop sia streyt per strictura subtil.	However, it is possible that there might be a twisting or a small fissure, then you should not waste time with your hand and a whole compressive force.  Instead, apply appropriate medicines to that spot, as remembered at that time that suits the location, and then tightly bandage it with a fine bandage.
E sapias que·l loc quan es arcuat e no es scindit en dos o otra aquo que no accidan en lu satagie, cum es remauguda tota partida de la sua compar, lahoras cove que comenses de la tua hora a rectificacio de lu habantz que a lu accida apostema caut.	And know that when the fractured spot is curved, but not completely broken in two or otherwise damaged in the structure, with the whole part of its composure remaining, then you must, from this point forward, begin to correct it, lest an inflamed boil occur there.
E si a lu accida apostema caut, lahoras layssa aquel per alcus dias entro que cesse le apostema; e aprop engualha aquel segon quascuna manieyra que podes de levitat e de engen.	And if a painful boil forms there, then leave it for a few days until the boil subsides; and then bandage it according to any method you can, with gentleness and skill.
E sapias que restauracio de lu e agulacio de lu es pus leugiera que del os en le qual accideysso sathagie.	And know that the restoration and healing of a curved bone is easier than when it's broken/fractured in a more severe manner.
E aprop strenh aquel segon que vindra la rememoracio de lu.	And then strengthen it according to the instructions that follow.
Mays si en le os so satagias, lahoras es necessaria extencio de aquest membre trencat de doas partz, si es la ma o le pe; o am la tua ma si le membre es petit; o am doas cordas o am una corda e la ma.	But if the bone is fractured, then an extension of the broken limb (whether hand or foot) is necessary; use your hand if the limb is small, or two ropes, or one rope and your hand.
E sia la tua posicio am la qual pauses le membre loc engual segon la sua figura natural, mentre que las partidas so extandudas del membre trenquat, lahoras te perforsa que fassas retornar aquelas addicios am engen e segon quascuna manieyra que poyras en lor locs.	And maintain the position in which you place the limb in a bandage according to its natural shape, while the fractured limb parts are extended, then you must carefully return those additions to their places with skill and in any way possible.
E guarda te segon la tua forssa que no accida sobre le malaute per la tua operacio delor ni lesio; e perforsa te segon le tieu poder que tu appliques la un os am l’autre son companho segon lors milhors formas.	And be careful, with your strength, that your treatment does not cause pain or injury to the patient; and strive to fit one bone to its companion according to their best forms, to the best of your ability.
E cove que en aquela hora aprofitablament tu toques am la tua ma aquel, e si vezes aqui alcuna causa diversa, rectifiqua aquel e enguala aquel per la quantitat de la tua vertut.	And it is fitting that at that time you carefully touch it with your hand, and if there is any different cause, correct it and make it whole with your skill.
E exquiva vehement extenssio e compressio, ayssi cum fan mots fols metges que motas veguadas fan accidir apostema caut per la sua operacio, o fan accidir contraccio en le membre ayssi cum havem vist aquo per la operacio de lor motas veguadas.	Avoid excessive extension and compression, as some foolish doctors often cause a painful abscess by their treatment, or cause contraction in the limb, as we have seen happen many times with their treatment.
E aprop annecteys, aprop equacio e decent operacio e strictura de aquel membre, e repaus e tranquilitat; amoneste le malaute sobre aquo e fay le squivar que no maugua aquel en la hora de las suas vigilias e del sieu dormir, e ves la sua revolucio e agitacio, e deves la sua egestio, e deves totz les sieus movementz am tota la sua vertut; e aguarda se que la posicio del membre sia posicio am la qual sia asegurada la dolor, la qual causa es quar quan sent en la disposicio de la posicio del membre delor o lesio; lahoras cove que permutes aquel ad autra disposicio de aquela am la qual non senta dolor; e guarda am aquo que la posicio de lu aquela sia dreyta e engual, per so que al membre non accida tortuositat quan es restaurat.	Then, proceed with careful, appropriate treatment, and stricture of that limb, and rest and tranquility. Advise the patient about this and ensure that they avoid moving it during their waking hours and sleep, and observe their movement and agitation, and control all their movements with all your skill; and ensure that the position of the limb is one that relieves the pain, because pain is often a result of the limb's position.  If the position causes pain or injury, then you should change it to another position that does not cause pain, and ensure that the limb's position is straight and sound, so that the limb doesn't become crooked when it is restored.
E la qualitat de la strictura del membre tranquat es aquela que yeu recomti; per que sapias que·ls membres trencatz so diversificatz en lor parvitat e en lor grandeza e en la forma de aquels.	The quality of the stricture applied to the still limb is what I am recommending; so that you know that broken limbs vary in their smallness and largeness and in the form of those limbs.
E de aquels que son petits ayssi cum le bras e·l dit e·l focil e semblantz ad aquels, lahoras cove que la envolucio sia de drap mol subtil.	And for those that are small, such as the arm, finger, and similar parts, the wrapping should be of fine, soft cloth.
Mays aquels que so grosses ayssi cum la cuoyssa o la camba, cove que en aquels sia envolucio lada e dura, quar la liadura lada connecteys le membre gran e strenh aquel de tota part am strictura engual, enayssi que en lu no intre macula.	However, for those that are large, such as the thigh or leg, the wrapping should be firm and strong, for the firm bandage unites the large limb and binds it securely in every part, so that no foreign matter enters.
E aprop comensa, aprop la tua evacuacio de equacio, pausar liament convenient ad aquo, sobre le loc de aquela fractura am tres envolucios o quatre segon que·l membre mereys; e strenh la tua ma un petit am le liament.	And then, proceed with your treatment, placing a suitable bandage over the fracture site, using three or four wraps, according to the limb's needs; and gently tighten the bandage with your hand.
E aprop ve am aquel a la partida pus sobirana del loc de la fractura, e strenh mens que no foc la tua strictura am la qual has strengut le loc de la fractura.	And then, approach with that to the most prominent part of the fracture site, and tighten less than you tightened the fracture site with your previous bandage.
E aprop elongua te am envolucio del loc de la fractura un pauc, e mollifiqua la strictura petit a petit, entro que prenguas del loc sa una gran partida.	And then, gently loosen the wrapping of the fracture site a little, and gradually release the tightness, until you have pulled the area of the fracture apart significantly.
E aprop pren una autra benda e envolveys aquela autra veguada sobre le loc trenquat am envolucio, e aprop ve am las envolucios a la partida pus dejos de la fractura; e sia la tua operacio en la strictura de la envolucio e en mollificacio de aquela segon que havem dit en la envolucio primieyra desus.	And then take another bandage and wrap it again over the broken area, using turns, and then proceed with the wraps to the lowest part of the fracture; and your procedure should be in the tightening of the wrapping and in releasing it, as we have described in the first wrap above.
E aprop pausa entre las volucios de stopa leon o drap am le qual sia engualada la tortuositat de la fractura, si en lu es tortuositat; e sino, no pauses en lu alcuna causa.	And then place, between the wraps, a piece of linen or cloth to encompass the crookedness of the fracture, if there is any; and if not, do not put anything there.
E aprop pausa sobre lu autra benda, e aprop enguala sobre aquestas envolucios stelhas decentment faytas tantost, si en le loc no es imflacio o apostema caut, e lahoras pausa sobre lu aquo que sede le apostema aquel e que oste la imflacio; e layssa aquela per alcus jorns; e lahoras tu strenh sobre lu las stelhas.	And then place another bandage over these carefully applied wraps, immediately, if there is no inflammation or harmful abscess at the site.  And if there is, place on it whatever soothes the abscess and reduces the inflammation; leave that for a few days; and then tighten the bandages over it.
E sian las stelhas de la maytat de canna lada raza, e be formada saviament; o sian de fust de pi; o de ramps de palma ; e sia le ample de quascuna stelha segon aquesta forma e aquesta figura:	Let the splints be made of half of a slender, straight piece of wood, or be fashioned from pine wood, or palm fronds; and let the width of each splint be according to this shape and this form:
Empero cove que la astelha que es pausada sobre aquela fractura sia pus grossa e pus lada un petit que las autras astelhas, e la longitut de la stela segon qu’es legut al membre en magnitut e parvitat; e aprop strenh sobre las astelhas am autra benda segon la tua primieyra strictura; e aprop lia desus am fiel decentment segon que havem dit de strictura, e es que sia la tua strictura segon le loc de la fractura mes, e quant mes es alonguat de la fractura, es mendre la strictura.	However, the splint placed over the fracture should be slightly thicker and wider than the other splints, and the length of the splint according to the size and smallness of the limb; and then tighten the splints with another bandage according to your first tightening; and then tie it securely above with thread, as we have said about the tightening, and let your tightening be over the area of the fracture, and the further away from the fracture the less tightness.
E cove que les fils sian migiers en grossesa e subtilitat, e sian de li mol; e si les fils so grosses, ayssi cum yeu he vist per la operacio de alcus fols pausantz les lors fils de cordas de li tort, e es error gran, quan catz la strictura fora equalitat.	And the threads should be medium in thickness and fine, and be made of linen; and if the threads are thick, as I have seen some fools do in their surgeries, using thick ropes or twine for threads, it is a great error, when the tightening lacks uniformity.
E eyssament fils subtils no so convenientz, quar tu no consaguiras per strictura am aquels aquo que voles, e no cove que entre astela e astela haja mens de un dit.	And similarly, very thin threads are not suitable, for you will not achieve the desired tightening with them, and there should not be less than a finger's width between each splint.
E si le malaute es ledit per las extremitatz de las stelas aprop la strictura en les locs sas, lahoras pausa dejos aquelas de stopa leon o lana carmenada entro que aquo no li fassa lesio.	And if the patient is irritated by the edges of the splints near the tightening in those places, then place underneath those splints some soft wool or carded wool until it does not cause him/her any injury.
Alcunas veguadas fractura es am plagua, e accideys disrupcio en la codena, e yeu vindre am rememoracio en aquela en le capitol segon singularitat.	Sometimes a fracture occurs with a wound, and there is a disruption of the bone, and I will discuss it in detail in the second chapter of the singular cases.
E sapias que ges tot membre trencat no es streyt am stelhas al primier dia; la qual causa es quar le membre, quan es gran, no cove que pauses sobre lu stelhas sino aprop v dias o vii o mays, segon la tua seguratat de adveniment de apostema caut.	And know that not every broken limb should be tightened with splints on the first day; this is because when the limb is large, you should not place splints on it until approximately five or seven days, or more, depending on your certainty of avoiding a suppurative inflammation.
E aquesta es la manieyra dels emplaustres am les quals les Antics restauravan, les quals so pausatz sobre fractura e dislocacio e torcio.	And this is the method of plasters with which the ancients treated fractures, dislocations, and sprains.
Manieyra de emplaustra comu abruejat de restaurament de fractura, convenient a motas compleccios e majorment a las femnas e als efantz, quar es de aquo sobre le qual no ventz calor ni freg: e es que prenguas de polvera de moli, e es la medula de la farina que pen deves le movement de la mola en las paretz del moli.	A method of a common plaster for fracture repair, suitable for many complexions, especially women and children, because it does not produce heat or cold: take ground flour powder, which is the medulla of the flour that remains on the walls of the mill after grinding.
E comfeys aquel ayssi cum es, sino que cribelles aquel am album de huou, e pausa la comfeccio de lu no-spessa ni subtil; e aprop usa de aquela.	And make it like this, but sieve it with egg white, and spread the mixture thinly and not too subtly; and then use it.
Autra manieyra de emplaustre restaurant fractura e dislocacio e torcio: recipe de assafetida, de lapdanum, de acacia, de enula, e migrach, que es razit de milgraner salvage, de totz ana drac. x; de mirra e aloen ana drac. v; alochil ana drac. xx; totz sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian mesclatz am aygua alichil o am album de huou si la compleccio del malaute es scalfada; e aprop usa de aquest emplaustre, quar es de bona composicio e restaura les osses trencatz leugierament, e confereys a motz homes.	Another method of plaster for treating fractures, dislocations, and sprains: a recipe using assafoetida, opoponax, acacia, enula, and wild chamomile root, each one ounce; myrrh and aloes, half an ounce each; aloes, two ounces; all crushed, sifted, and mixed with rosewater or egg white if the patient's complexion is sensitive; and then use this plaster, as it is well-composed and heals slightly broken bones, and is beneficial for many people.
Autra manieyra de emplaustre le qual comfereys a fractura e torcio: recipe migrach e met de altea blanca ana drac. x; de mirra e de aloen ana drac v; de acacia drac. vi; de bol armenic drac. .xx.	Another method of plaster beneficial for fractures and sprains: recipe using wild chamomile and white marshmallow root, one ounce each; myrrh and aloes, half an ounce each; acacia, six ounces; and Armenian bole, two ounces.
Totz sian trissatz en mortier am mota contricio, e sian cribellatz, e sian comfitz am aygua o am album de huou e sia administrat.	All are crushed in a mortar with great effort, sifted, and mixed with water or egg white, and then applied.
Manieyra de emplaustre a juncturas e osses separatz de lors locs, e seda dolor accident en aquels e a fissuras e fractaduras: sia presa lana sutza e sia submersa en vi agre e oli cuyt e sia pausat sobre le loc.	A method of plaster for joints and bones dislocated from their places, and for pain, fissures, and fractures: take a piece of absorbent wool, soak it in sour wine and boiled oil, and place it on the affected area.
Mays en aquest emplastre no es vertut de restauracio, de apostema caut e expelleys dolors propriament.	However, this plaster does not have the virtue of restoring, but it is good for resolving suppurative sores and expelling pain effectively.
Autra manieyra de emplastre que restaura os trancat: pren fuelas de figuier sort e fuelas de papaver salvatge; contereys tot e fay emplastre de lor.	Another method of plaster for mending a broken bone: take leaves of wild fig and leaves of wild poppy; crush them all together and make a plaster from them.
Manieyra de emplastre abreujat aministrat deves la restauracio de fractura de os e quan tu voles resolucio del romanent de apostema: recipe razitz de altea, de camamilla e flors de violes, de farina de ers, de totz ana partida i; sian totz trissatz e sian cofitz am vi, si·l membre no es scalfat.	A quick method of plaster for aiding in the healing of a broken bone, and when you want resolution of remaining suppuration: take roots of marshmallow, chamomile, and violet flowers, and ground elder; pulverize all into a powder, mix with wine if the affected limb is not inflamed.
Mays si es scalfat, lahoras comfeys aquel am aygua de coliandre humit o am aygua e usa de lu.	But if it is inflamed, then mix it with moist coriander water or with plain water and use it.
Autra manieyra de emplastra pus fort en resolucio que aquest primier, quan accideys apostema dur deves la restauracio del membre: recipe de razitz de altea e de semensa de li, e de balaustia, e mellilot, majorana, flors de viol, de camamilla, de totz ana partida i engual; totz sian trissatz e sian cofitz am aygua de sauze o am aygua dousa o am vi, tot aquo segon la qualitat del membre e le repaus de la color de lu.	Another stronger plaster for resolving suppuration, better than the first, when you have a hard abscess preventing limb healing: take roots of marshmallow, seeds of flax, and bramble, melilot, marjoram, violet flowers, chamomile; pulverize everything into powder, mix with willow water, or plain water, or wine, depending on the quality of the limb and the color (condition) of it.
Mays Ypocras no diyssec en le sieu libre que sia pausat sobre le membre trenquat deves la restauracio de lu sino cerot fayt de cera e de oli e no autre causa; e recomtec que sia migier entre grossitut e subtilitat.	However, Hippocrates in his book does not say to put it on a broken limb during healing, but rather a cerate made of wax and oil, and nothing else; and recommends it to be of medium thickness, neither too thick nor too thin.
Mays a Gualia es vist que sian pausatz sobre le membre trencat deves la restauracio de lu e las causas en las quals es exsiccacio am petit de caliditat so ayssi cum mirra, enses e semblantz a lor de aquelas causas que havem recomtadas.	However, in Gaul, it is seen that they are applied to a broken limb during healing, and the ingredients for which there is desiccation with slight warmth, such as myrrh, frankincense, and similar to those mentioned earlier.
Manieyra de emplastre que comfereys a lesio e dolor: recipe migat, de cezes, de pels de home inscizes o pena de auzel, e de altea, e sal, partidas enguals; sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian cofitz, e sia fayt emplastre.	A plaster for injuries and pain: take equal parts of chickweed, human skin (or bird's), marshmallow root, and salt; grind and sift them, and then mix to form a plaster.
Mays la quantitat segon la qual cove que romangua la liadura e aprop sia disliada, es que consideres si no es accidit dolor ni pruziment ni le os es trencat no es maugut de son loc, lahoras tu no deslies de motz jorns.	However, the length of time the bandage should remain, and when it should be removed, depends on whether there is pain, swelling, or whether the bone is broken and out of place.  If none of these occur, then do not remove the bandage for several days.
E si accideys al loc dolor vehement o prusiment o imflacio, lahoras tu te coyte o deslie aquel en la hora, e osta le emplastre de lu.	And if there is severe pain, swelling, or inflammation at the site, then you should unwrap or remove it immediately, and remove the plaster.
E pren drap de li e spongia marina leon humida, e submergeys aquela en aygua tebeza, e am aquela lava le loc entro que cesse aquel pruziment e la dolor sia sedada; e aprop layssa repausar le membre per una hora; e aprop pausa sobre lu lana sutza submersa en vi agre e oli o oli rozat, e lia sobre lu per una nuoyt entro que sias segur de apostema caut, e que repause la imflacio del membre, e sia remauguda la dolor de lu.	And take a clean cloth and a damp sponge of sea sponge, and soak it in lukewarm water, and with that wash the area until the swelling subsides and the pain is relieved; then let the limb rest for an hour; and then apply a layer of wool soaked in vinegar and oil or rosemary oil, and bandage it overnight until you are sure the inflammation is down, and the pain of the limb has subsided.
E aprop itera aquela strictura subtil e emplastre petit e no·l strenhas per la tua constriccio primieyra, e subtilia am aquel entro que sia sanat.	Then, repeat this subtle compression and apply a small plaster, without the initial tightness, and use it until healed.
E si vezes que le apostema e la rogor e la dolor e la imflacio e tots les accidentz ja so remaugutz de tot, e indigeysses de emplastre e de strictura, lahoras tu itera aquel ayssi cum has fayt al comensant engualment.	And if the abscess, stiffness, pain, inflammation, and all the symptoms have completely subsided, and you no longer need a plaster or compression, then repeat the process as you did at the beginning.
E si no accideys al membre alcuna causa de aquelas que havem ditas, lahoras no deslies aquel sino aprop tres dias o quatre o v o vii; e alcunas veguadas tot aquo es layssat per xx dias segon que a tu appar per la desliadura del membre, ayssi cum havem dit, entro que la fractura adhereys, e se acosta a la coagulacio de la carn sobre aquel.	And if there is no cause for any of those symptoms in the limb, then do not remove it for about three or four or five or seven days; and sometimes all of this is left for twenty days, as it appears to you from the treatment of the limb, as we have said, until the fracture adheres and the flesh coagulates around it.
E lahoras ajusta en la strictura mays que en la tua strictura primieyra tota, e ayusta en la engrossacio de la vianda del malaute, segon que es precedida la rememoracio de lu.	Then, apply more compression to the bandage than you did initially, and increase the patient's diet, according to what is necessary for their recovery.
Mays si tu vezes le loc de la fractura ja desiccar e extenuar mays que no cove, lahoras sapias que·l nutriment es prohibit pervenir ad aquel; e donc embroca aquel am aygua tebeza deves tota veguada que delias aquel; e sia aquo en totz tres dias; e alleuja la strictura un petit, e per aquesta operacio corr al membre le nutriment, e es sanat leugierament.	However, if you find the fracture site is already drying out and weakening more than necessary, understand that nourishment is prevented from reaching it.  Therefore, moisten it with lukewarm water every time you remove the dressing.  Do this for three days.  Loosen the bandage slightly, and through this action, nourishment returns to the limb, leading to quick healing.
Mays aquo que fan les fols restauradors de la fractura del membre autra veguada quan no es restaurat al comensament, segon que cove, e es restaurat segon tortuositat, es error segon la operacio de lor, e temor gran, e si fos dreyturier aquo agrandit les Antics en lors libres e agueran am aquo obrat.	But what those foolish bone setters do to a fractured limb a second time, when it wasn't properly set the first time, and it is set with crookedness, is a mistake in their practice, a great danger.  If they had done it correctly, the ancients in their books would have written about it, and they would have acted accordingly.
E yeu no he vist ad alcu de lor aquo far, per que es pus razonable que aquo no fassa.	And I have not seen anyone of them do this, which makes it more reasonable not to do it.
Capitol segon: De fractura quan accideys en le cap.	Second Chapter: Of fractures when they occur to the head.
Las specias de fracturas son motas, e las figuras de lor son diversas, e las causas son distinctas, quar de fracturas alcuna es fayta per percussio de spaza, e la percussio osta tot le os entro al ciphac, le qual es dejos le os, ayssi cum fay ayssa en le fust, e per aquo aquesta specia es nompnada ascial; o la spaza inscideys alcuna partida del os, e inscideys la carn de lu e no passa la inscizio entro al derier de lu; e aquesta specia de fractura es nompnada levatio absoluta.	The types of fractures are many, and their shapes are diverse, and the causes are distinct, for some fractures are caused by a blow of a weapon, and the blow shatters all the bone to the skull, which is underneath the bone, just as a blow does to a wooden post.  Thus, this type is called a splintered fracture; or the weapon cuts a part of the bone, and cuts into the flesh but does not cut through to the back of the bone; and this type of fracture is called a simple separation.
E la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca, e de fractura que es contricio o atricio; e causa de lu es percussio am poyra o cazement sobre peyra, e a lor semblantz.	And the severity of these two fractures is either great or small, and a fracture that is a crushing or a grinding; and the cause is a blow with a stone or a fall on a rock, and the like.
E aquesta fractura o es penetrant que ja apropinqua al pannicol le qual es dejos le os; o es en la facia del os, e la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca.	And this fracture is either penetrating, approaching the membrane beneath the bone; or it is on the surface of the bone, and the severity of these two fractures is either great or small.
E de fractura es que es ameguada en le os, en la subtilitat del cabel petita, e per aquo es nompnada aquesta specia fractura capillar.	And a fracture is one that is hidden within the bone, in the smallness of a hair, and thus this type is called a hairline fracture.
E es fractura que es fayta o per cazement o per percussio de peyra e a lu semblantz, que fa intrar alcuna lamina del os a las partidas dedintz, e es fayta en le loc concavitat ayssi cum accideys als payroles de eram quan accideys a lor percussio e es partida de lor intrada a las partidas dedintz.	And a fracture is one made either by falling or by a blow of a stone and similar things, that causes a portion of the bone to enter into its cavity, just as happens to the ribs when struck, and a part of their entry is into the cavities within.
E majorment es fayt aquo en les cors de osses humitz, ayssi cum so caps de efantz.	This is more often the case in the soft bones, like the skulls of infants.
E so a totas aquestas specias fracturas satagias, so son pessas ayssi cum stelhas separadas.	And in all these types of fractures, the pieces are scattered like separated shards.
E yeu vindre am reremoracio de tot aquo en son loc.	And I will come with the remedy for all of this, restoring it to its place.
E conoyssem totas aquestas specias de fractura per deteccio sobre aquelas e per inquisicio de lor am tentas e ostament de carn corrumpuda que es sobre lor.	And we recognize all these types of fractures by examining them and by inquiring about them with probes and examining the decaying flesh that is on top of them.
E specia capillar es conoguda per aysso que es descubert sobre le os, e es abstergit, e linit sobre lu am tentha, quar la fractura appar negra.	A splinter fracture is recognized because it's exposed on the bone, and it is cleaned and probed, because the fracture appears black.
Mays en la curacio de fractura considera al comensament les accidentz del malaute, e lahoras si tu vezes per los accidentz que signifique per significacio manifesta sobre paor, ayssi cum es vomit de colera, e extencio, e perdement de entendament, e abscizio de votz, e sincopi, e febre acuta, e eyssiment dels huels e rogor de aquels, e semblantz a lor dels accidentz en las majors disposicios, ses dopte no es sanat.	But in the treatment of a fracture, consider first the patient's symptoms, and if you observe symptoms that indicate great peril, such as vomiting of bile, extensive pain, loss of consciousness, loss of voice, fainting, acute fever, swelling and stiffness of the affected areas, and similar symptoms to those in serious cases, without a doubt, it will not be healed.
E si vezes accidentz no-correntz tu speras salut, lahoras tu comensa la curacio de lu.	And if you observe symptoms that are not severe, you expect recovery, then you begin the treatment of it.
La qual causa es quar si es vengut a tu le plaguat en le comensament cum es plaguat e aquo es en les dias de ivern, lahoras cove que tu studias en le ostament del os denant le dia xiiii segon tota disposicio.	The reason for this is that if the injured person comes to you at the beginning of the injury, and this is during the winter days, then you must study the examination of the bone before the fourteenth day according to all circumstances.
E si es en les dias d’estiu, lahoras cove que te coytes ostar le os denant le vii dia, habantz que aquo que es dejos le os sia corromput del pannicol, e que accidescan les accidentz que havem recomtatz.	And if it is in the summer days, then you must try to examine the bone before the seventh day, fearing that what is beneath the bone may be corrupted by the swelling, and that the symptoms we have mentioned may occur.
E si la fractura ja es pervenguda al pannicol cubrent le cervel, e es am partidas menudas e atricio, lahoras cove que inscidas la partida conminuta e atrita, segon que yeu recomtare a tu.	And if the fracture has already reached the swelling covering the brain, and it has small fragments and grinding, then you must incise the broken and ground part, as I will advise you.
E es que tu razas le cap del malaute plaguat, e descuebres sobre le os segon costuma e manieyra a tu possible segon la figura de la plagua, e que sia leugier sobre le malaute.	And you must shave the head of the injured patient, and uncover the bone according to the custom and manner possible for you, according to the nature of the injury, and be gentle on the patient.
E si accideys a tu deves la deteccio del os, fluxs de sanc o apostema caut, lahora tu te oppausa a lu am aquo que cove, e es que huemplas le loc de draps infuzes en vi e oli rozat, e fassa repausar la plagua entro que sia sedat le apostema, e sies segur de fluxs del sanc; e aprop comensa en la circuicio del os e en la ablatio de lu.	And if you encounter bone exposure, bleeding or a hot abscess, you must treat it with what is appropriate.  You should fill the area with cloths soaked in wine and rubbed oil, and allow the wound to rest until the abscess subsides, and the bleeding ceases. Then begin the process of examining the bone and removing it.
E aquo sia segon una de dos manieyras de operacio.	And this will be according to one of two methods of operation.
E la una manieyra es que tu inscidas le os am inscisori de streyt tal, e aquesta es la forma de lu: E aprop administra un autre inscissori aquest, un pauc pus lat que aquel; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And one method is that you cut the bone with a narrow, sharp scalpel.  This is its form: Then, you place another scalpel slightly further out than the first one.  This is its form:
E aprop administra mays le inscissori pus lat que·l segon.	And then place a scalpel further out than the second one.
E cove que sia deves tu nombre de inscissoris diverses, dels quals alcus so pus latz que alcus autres; e alcus de lor so pus breus que·ls autres e sian en le derier de acuitat de las suas extremitatz, e sian de ferr indi o felod.	And you should have several different scalpels, some wider than others, some shorter than others, with sharpened ends, and made of tempered iron or steel.
E usa de lor am facilitat en percussio sobre le inscissori per so que no concutesca le cap e leda aquel.	And use them with ease when striking the scalpel, so that you don't injure the head and spoil it.
E si le os es fort, dur, lahoras cove que perfores en le circuit de lu denant que tu administres los inscissoris am les taravels, les quals so nomnatz taravels no-profundantz.	And if the bone is strong, hard, then it is necessary to perforate it around before you use the scalpels with the instruments called non-penetrating probes.
E no so nomnatz ayssi sino quar aquels no pausan le terme de l’os del test ad aquo que es aprop lu, per so quar al taravel es redonda extremitat o marge sobre aquel que es dejos le cap de lu agut semblant a marge o a cercle petit, le qual prohibeys esser submergit e passar la spissitut del os.	And they are not called that (non-penetrating probes) except because they do not penetrate the bone's surface, since the probe has a rounded tip or edge on the one below the pointed head, like a small edge or circle that prevents it from going further and penetrating the thickness of the bone.
E es convenient que tu prenguas de aquestz taravels gran nombre dels quals quascu convenesca a la spicitut de quascun os, entro que sia a tu present en tottz testz del cervel la extremitat del qual sia aguda, la quantitat en longitut e brevitat sia segon la quantitat de spicitut de aquest test.	And it is appropriate for you to take a large number of these probes, each suited to the thickness of each bone, so that you have on hand for every skull bone a probe with a sharp tip, its length and shortness being according to the thickness of the skull.
E aquesta es la forma de tres specias de teravels: La qualitat de perforar en le circuit del os trencat es que pauses le teravel sobre le os e revolvas aquel am les tieus ditz entro que sapias que l’os ja es penetrat; e aprop permuda le terevel ad autre loc, e pausa aquo que es entre tot trauc la quantitat de la grosseza del ray o enviro aquo.
